reviews.text: I met a couple of old friends for lunch.  I&#39;ve never visited The Cheesecake Factory so I&#39;m not sure what to expect. <br><br>We arrived when the restaurant opens for the lunch crowd.  I have no idea how popular this place is.  The hostess who wasn&#39;t in the best of moods seated us.  First, I thought it was just me.  It wasn&#39;t.  <br><br>They offer a variety of choices on their menu.  I love the fact that they have full disclosure of nutrition information.  But, then again, I found myself looking for the least calorie item on the menu.  I indulged myself looking at the dessert section of the menu just a bit longer.  I settled on the chopped salad, minus a few ingredients.  <br><br>There was a child sitting near by screamed throughout my meal.  It was difficult to ignore. The place was clean. Our waiter, Ivan, was friendly and was very accommodating provided outstanding service.  <br><br>Would I go back?  Sure, I would.  Just let me get the sound of a child&#39;s scream out of my head first.

Everything was delicious as usual!  I love my Bang-bang chicken and shrimp.  It was not spicy at all to me when the description said that it was spicy.  It was more sweet than anything because it had coconut flakes to it.  Our waitress was really nice.  I had my 2 nephews with me too and she was so sweet to slice up some bananas for the 2 toddlers.  It was an excellent luncheon!

I have never been to the Cheesecake Factory before, but I definitely was not disappointed.  The menu is a bit overwhelming so make sure you pull it up online before visiting, or just order something basic so you aren&#39;t second guessing yourself.  I will visit again.

Cheesecake has an extensive menu. Large portions decent variety not bad for a chain restaurant. The burger was heated thru tasted like rare meat warmed was good on a nice piece  of crusty French bread. <br>I had black beans and rice with a yummy pineapple salsa and shrimp they were on the small side and a little over cooked. You can tell right away the shrimp were in a tight circle instead of a C. My friend was hungry and I settled since I dragged him shopping. Not the best and not the worst.  The end. Till next time.

I enjoy eating here due to the menu options. It has healthy options and options for my girlfrIend as well. Never had a bad experience here. I ordered the Renee&#39;s special which is my favorite because It is fairly healthy and fulfilling for a dinner. My girlfriend oRdered pasta  which was very good. Service was not terrible but we did go early before it got crowded. Will definitely return.

Dinner at Cheesecake was great, especially considering Yelp&#39;s reservations never made it to the restaurant.  The hostess got us onto the waiting list and we were seated within 1/2 hour.  DO NOT use Yelp reservations, call &amp; get onto their list instead.

We were dining at Cheesecake Factory Saturday and had a great meal.<br>Our waitstaff was very helpful and our meal and extra&#39;s arrived quickly.<br>As we were leaving I decided to get a slice of Cheesecake to go. I used a give card for one slice. Later I found a problem with the purchase a error on my part. I talked to Ben the manager and he was great took care of the problem very efficiently. I was very happy of the results. Alway a good time here.

For a chain, the Cheesecake Factory is really good!  They have a huge menu that can please anyone, they have good service, and the food is pretty delicious.  They&#39;re portions are huge, so you will always have leftovers.  Last time I was there, I had the aperol frozen spritz. This drink was really tasty and refreshing.  My husband and I split the Nashville hot chicken nuggets which were much better than ordinary nuggets. They were very flavorful and tender.  I tried the chicken Madeira, since it&#39;s their top dish, and it really was good! The chicken, asparagus, and potatoes were all cooked perfectly.  The Madeira sauce was soooo good!  The size of this entree could probably feed two!

Ugh. We had lunch there and it was terrible. The teriyaki chicken was greasy and covered with skin My husband couldn&#39;t eat it. I had  caesar salad which was okay, potato soup which was terrible (who puts carrots in potato soup)and half a chicken almond sandwich. My meal was delivered after hubby was almost finished. Just okay. We eat at Cheesecake all the time and this was terrible compared to the others <br>However, they get one star for the cheesecake. That&#39;s always good.

This is by far the worst I mean worst lunch meal ever. THE WAITRESS SHOULD BE TERMINATED. Sadly we left a tip. <br><br>We were seated at a booth along the main aisle of the very noisy restaurant. Sitting for almost 10 minutes before we were noticed. There is a railing between the three of us seated in the booth and the aisle. <br><br>The HORRIBLE waitress conducted all our service over the railing. Bread, over the rail. Drinks, over the rail. Entrees, over the rail. Thus, we had to pass our food and drinks to each other so in fact  we were the waitstaff. After lunch we had to pass our empty plates over the rail. <br><br>I hope everyone who reads this does not have the same experience. On the way out there was no one at the host/hostess station or I would have demanded the manager. <br><br>I will never dine at CHEESECAKE FACTORY Agand tell every single person I know to do the same. <br><br>I accidentally hit one star. My mistake no stars is more accurate. <br><br>I have submitted my comments directly to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s comment website. My remarks stand. Speaking with my two friends I had lunch with, they too will NEVER visit Cheesecake Factory again. They also intend to discourage others from visiting there. <br><br>NEVER HEARD FROM MANAGEMENT, we should have been offered a comped visit to see that things have improved.

Korean BBQ cauliflower bites and their ranch sauce: I loved it! Such a great substitute for chicken. A little spicy but the ranch helps.<br><br>Chicken Madeira: Great! Pounded out chicken, light breading, pan-fried, topped with mozzarella and asparagus. Served with mashed potatoes. The portions are hugeee. Definitely recommend on deliciousness alone. It has 1200 calories and 70 carbs. (I assume that the potatoes are counted separate)<br><br>Pineapple chicken and shrimp: it had a sauce reduction and served with rice. Not sure it was worth it for 1600 calories and 230 carbs!<br><br>Chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake: light creaminess on top. Then the cheesecake was heavy. The bottom cake layer is too dense. I never understand why they don&#39;t make it crispier and crunchier. I also don&#39;t know why I hope for this everytime. Also I was too afraid to look up the nutrition facts. Hah.

I called in an order for a cheesecake for curbside pick up and the I was told to hang up go online and order it.  I did that and I was told it&#39;ll take about 20 minutes until it&#39;s ready.  I arrived at their curbside pick up and was told it wasn&#39;t ready.  Anyway... to make a very story short, I ended up waiting about an hour.  I left when I finally got the cheese cake given to me at their curbside pick up.  When I opened the bag and looked inside, I saw the cheesecake was put in an old wrinkly box AND there was a thumb print on the frosting.  When I called and spoke to a manager he got very defensive and said they never give out old boxes and employees open the boxes to see what kind of cake is in there before they sell it.  I don&#39;t know if that person&#39;s thumb had a glove on.  We didn&#39;t feel safe eating it.  The manager was rude, yelling at me and he didn&#39;t believe what I was telling him.  Well, here&#39;s the pictures, FYI.

As with most Cheesecake Factories, the menu is large which is great, and the food is excellent. I really do enjoy this location because it&#39;s on the second floor, the view is wonderful.<br><br>The only thing to be aware of is that the wait can be VERY long (sometimes 45 minutes, but occasionally a full hour). Also, as much as I love the mini-bar and the service is top notch, the drink prices are a little high I must say.

We came with a stroller and had to park it on the other side of the restaurant, so if you plan on coming with a stroller keep that in mind. Their brown bread is delicious as always, the steak medallions on their skinnylicious menu were great and the portion size was just right, the spicy cashew chicken was good, it wasn&#39;t overly breaded and the portion was just right as well. We saw our server a couple of times, guess he figured we&#39;d call him if we needed anything.

Food: 3.5<br>Service: 4<br>Cleanliness: 3.5<br>Worth: I don&#39;t think it&#39;s worth 1hr + wait on weekends, definitely try during the week or odd hours. And it&#39;s a bit pricey...<br><br>The iffy thing is they don&#39;t take reservations during peak times/weekends. Only off-peak  times which is early lunch 11am or mid-day (3-5pm) on weekdays.<br><br>The complimentary bread is to die for (specifically the brown bread). And you can get endless amount of &#39;em.<br><br>Order the fried avocado roll and calamari for appetizer, so goooood.<br><br>All pasta dishes are pretty good, sometimes it can be a little too oily but still tasty. I like that they offer &#34;skinny&#34; choices because the portions can be big!<br><br>The Bacon-Bacon burger was just ok. The bacon was too overdone and not the good kinda crunchy.<br><br>Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake: Yum. Super moist and décadent.<br><br>Dulce De Lèche Caramel Cheesecake: Gooood. Ohhhkay sweet and mild.<br><br>Would I come back? Only for special occasion, gift card or lunch hours.<br><br>(They need to turn up the lights a bit, too dim to even read their extensive menu)

Not much to say other than it is the Cheesecake Factory and it was opened late on Saturday.  Food is pretty standard, although my husband loved their white chili with rice.  I had the Chicken and Biscuits, which could have used some seasoning.  I took it home and had it the next day after adding some flavor to it...it was pretty good.  The biscuits were good, but it looked as it they were cooked in a muffin tin based on the shape and coloring on the bottom of the biscuits.  It didn&#39;t impact the taste, was just strange to see muffin shaped biscuits.<br><br>For dessert we split the Celebration Cheesecake.  That was good as it had layers of Vanilla Cake, Cheesecake, Strawberry, Chocolate and Vanilla Mousse with Cream Cheese Frosting.  It was like eating birthday cake.<br><br>Be prepared to spend some time reading the menu as it is extensive.

Terrible server. Fernando R was our server. He messed up my entire and appetizers twice, I ended up not eating because everything took too long. I don&#39;t recommend this location. Terrible service and food
This cheesecake location never fails to impress, great service and great food. I&#39;ll be Comin back soon!
Saul is the nicest human I&#39;ve ever met. Such a great waiter. He deserves the world. I love you Saul.

Some of the millennials that work there should consider working at Wendy&#39;s or Burger King, where their IDGAF attitude better matches. Great food. How can you argue that? But I&#39;m done w petty millennials w disrespectful tongues. I&#39;m too old for that crap, and frankly, they should be too.

Food good, as always. Staff nice, as always. BUT my first time eating inside during COVID so called ahead of time to find out how it works since they have no outdoor dining at Old Orchard. They told me they wiped down EVERYTHING including seats, distancing tables etc. as I was waiting for food I watched 2 tables leave and the clean up. NO seats were wiped down at all.  NOT GOOD COVID PRACTICE. When mentioned, as walking out door, hostess said &#34;I understand&#34;. That&#39;s it!  Nothing like I will talk to manager and make sure safety practices are in place.  If this happens, what else happens in kitchen and behind scenes.  Cheesecake Factory used to be a &#34;regular&#34; restaurant for family and clients.  No more!!!!!!  This is NOT SAFE DINING in these times!!! NOT OKAY!!!!!

Was there about 4:30 pm on Jan 16th 2020<br>Greeted at the host stand by a nice young man who seated me in a nice quiet large booth towards the back (across from elevator per my request)...waited for my gfriend to arrive...maybe after 5 minutes of sitting by myself I was greeted by Tali....she couldn&#39;t have been sweeter...smiley...chatty and hands on..kept filling my room temp water request <br>I haven&#39;t eaten at Cheesecake in some time and sitting there remembering how much I enjoyed it in the past...<br>I used to order salads<br>Last nite I wanted something different but couldn&#39;t seem to find on the menu...no BAKED POTATOES..I was crushed...so..I looked at the glazed beets and avocado...it looked interesting (on the menu)..my friend ordered same thing with grilled salmon on top that she suggested she&#39;d give me a piece of hers<br>When the salads arrived I was so disappointed by the size..the plate and serving were so small (for $8.50)...her piece of salmon was SUPER SMALL and I dare not to even ask for a taste..it was the tail end of the salmon and very thin and not too appetizing looking...so..I would not ever order those items again<br>But...did like Tali..and ambiance

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake various times and the customer service always has been great whether it has been eating inside or doing the curbside to go. The 3 dishes I usually choose from are the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, the Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo or the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. All 3 dishes I love and usually are one of the ones I choose from when I get food from there. When I usually go with family my mother usually gets the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp and both my father and brother get the Asian Cashew Chicken. When it comes to entrees we all usually love our food and usually have no issues, I think there was just one time where they didn&#39;t put any cashews in my dad&#39;s Asian Cashew Chicken which surprised us because that&#39;s part of the name of the dish (either way they resolved the issue quick). Now the only reason I&#39;m not giving it Cheesecake Factory a 5 is not because of this specific location but when it comes to some of the appetizers for the amount of money some of them cost, the portion sizes of the appetizers are quite small so be cautious. My family usually just orders the factory nachos now for an appetizer because it&#39;s a good amount of food to share. Other then that, I&#39;d definitely recommend giving this place a try  The family, friends and myself love going here often.<br><br>Keep up the great work Old Orchard Cheesecake Factory!

i dont usually write reviews, but this time i just had to. Person up front seems like he hates his job. I had to check with another waiter if you are still serving bread coz we weren&#39;t given. Chicken is dry. salad not enough dressing. slow service, it wasn&#39;t even busy.

We arrived at 7:45 and it was a 30 minute wait so my mom and I waited at the bar. After we were given menus, my mom ordered a lemon drop martini and I had a chocolate one. Mine was decent, but we asked them to remake the lemon drop. It was way too sour, we took the rinds out of the drink. When the second drink cane, it was better but only slightly. She didn&#39;t even finish it. For $13.00, the drink wasn&#39;t worth $2.00.<br><br>We were then seated and we ordered the calimari and the ahi tuna appetizers which were good. We split the steak Diane which is always good. We said medium, it had a more medium-rare spot. We then split the lemon meringue cheesecake.

I came here last Saturday to celebrate my friend Abigail&#39;s birthday, and my goodness Cheesecake Factory is amazing!<br><br>First of all, it was a large number of us, about 13 or so, and our waiter knew exactly how to handle a large party like us. Even considering the fact that Cheesecake Factory has the world&#39;s largest food menu, so you gotta prepared for any questions, and he was. So great service from him.<br><br>Secondly, the restaurant is so vibrant with its warm fainting lighting and night life atmosphere, I love it. Lastly, the food! I had a Mac and cheese burger cause I was craving a burger as of late, it knocks your socks off. <br><br>For dessert, I did have their peanut butter cheesecake. I won&#39;t go on a big description but the Cheesecake was so fresh and creamy. It&#39;ll leave you in shock and wanting more, and I was already full at time point!<br><br>For a first timer, I was greatly impressed, can&#39;t wait to go back!

It&#39;s easy to make me a fan of a restaurant -- give me good service, good food, and reasonable prices. That&#39;s not too much to ask, is it? Of course, I complicate things by being a vegan. That&#39;s right, folks, no animal products cross my lips! Thank goodness Cheesecake Factory had food for me on this February day, as well as my friend, who has, as she says, a seafood problem -- once she sees food, she eats it. Not vegan at all.<br><br>I had the Vegan Cobb Salad, which was absolutely delicious. I really loved it. In keeping with The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s reputation, it was a Big Salad, too -- I took home almost half of it, and had it for dinner. It was still good.<br><br>My friend had the lunch-portion Fish and Chips. She said it was good, but she was not a serious fan. She ate about half of it -- big portions, remember? -- but she didn&#39;t take the leftovers home with her. Frankly, I was surprised, because it was still a lot of food, but she said shhe really didn&#39;t care for it that much.<br><br>Service was fast, friendly, and efficient. <br><br>Only four stars instead of five, because I was very happy, and Ruth was not so happy. I would definitely go back to have the Vegan Cobb Salad again. Ruth would get something other than fish and chips.

I was so excited to be going to the cheesecake factory since I have not been to one in 20 years, moved away and just got back. We decided to have our work Christmas party there and I honestly could not have been more disappointed. I didn&#39;t mind waiting for the table, but once we were at the table it took about 15 minutes for the weather to come around and give us water, walking away before asking us if we wanted anything else to drink. 10 minutes after that he did come back and check the drink order, my coworkers had two rounds before he came back to ask what we wanted to eat even though the first time we came back all of our menus were down, we had all decided. After ordering the food it took over an hour to get 2 of the six entrees. The rest of us sat and watched the other two people eat and finally got our food after about another 10 minutes. Then when he came back to start clearing plates, my employer asked for the check. It took about another 15 minutes for him to come back with the check. I am well aware that waiting tables is not always easy, but there was no acknowledgment of the bad service much less an apology. <br>If I ever go back to cheesecake factory it definitely will not be that location. <br>Oh and the tacos were awful. The race was nasty, I don&#39;t even know what they put in it other than a ton of cilantro.

Like all Cheesecake Factories we have ever been to, this one was bustling on this Sunday afternoon.  It was a 25 minute wait at 2pm on this Sunday.  And why not - they have a very extensive menu, very reasonable prices, an energetic and upbeat atmosphere, complimentary bread/butter, and knowledgeable, efficient service.  For our brunch, wife had their stuffed mushroom appetizer and a cup (quite large!) of their cream of chicken with artichoke.  I had their lunch portion serving of the Louisiana chicken pasta (also quite large as expected).  Everything tasted great and was not over salted.  Only minor compliant from me on this place is that you likely will have a wait anytime you come here.  Will be back someday!

Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon (4/6) for a late brunch. Came because it said they had the impossible burger but when we ordered it, the waiter said it had been recalled from the restaurant, so they talked and he went with Evelyn&#39;s pasta and he said ire as good. I got the chicken and waffles Benedict. Everything was cooked nicely. Egg had a nice yolk. The complaint is the waiter barely came around. We were in there a very long time, too long that I didn&#39;t have time to have dessert so I placed my cheesecake order at the front counter, so he missed out on extra tip with extra food.  We were seated in an area that only had one way to access so that may be why but the other waiter of that section checked on his customers a lot. The cheese cakes we are later. Raspberry Lemon, so yummy! Not overly tart or sweet. Nice balance and oh so summery. Also got the Godiva that has a layer of flourless chocolate cake in addition to chocolate cheesecake and chocolate mousse! I love this one! So decadent and creamy! If you love chocolate, this is a must!
A large, lively location. I love the food, we always get an appetizer and a slice of cheesecake and the portions are big so that&#39;s enough. The original cheesecake with strawberries is the best!

It&#39;s over cheesecake. <br>It&#39;s not me, it&#39;s you. <br>You already know that you are not my go to, but for some reason other people still like you, so occasionally I end up with you through others. Every time I do, nothing changes. <br><br>Is cheesecake still charging upwards of 15 bucks for their booze drinks? Why yes they are. This hasn&#39;t changed in years! Who is paying this for their drinks?! Stop it people! This is not mixology central, there is no awe factor for the beverages here that would warrant such prices.<br><br>If you order the jambalaya shrimp pasta on the menu that says spicy, is it spicy? Nope.<br><br>I will give kudos on two counts, the burgers are good and the lettuce wrap taco option is actually some what affordable.<br><br>What was completely unforgivable? Notifying our server that we were celebrating my daughters 18 birthday and never hearing or seeing another word about it. No song, no dessert, no nothing. <br><br>Lastly, pretty darn sure the suggested tips at bottom of receipt were based on total amount, not sub total. <br><br>Sorry Cheese but you are just not worthy, other folks work harder for my dollars. CYA!

I live in the neighborhood. It is one of my favorite go to&#39;s. Consistently well-prepared food, great variety, excellent skinnylicious menu if you go to WW. But I&#39;ve never been prompted to put up a review until tonight. It was so crowded that we sat at the bar to eat and watched the bartender Christian prepare drinks and serve folks sitting at the bar. It was magical I&#39;ve never seen someone move that fast. And he was kind and attentive. Impressive. BTW really lovely atmosphere.

Every time I order food from here it&#39;s never as expected. I had to go factory nachos with chicken and that is not what I got. It was a bunch of stale chips with some cheese and hot sauce... no guac, no sour cream, no pico de gallo, not jalapeños, and no spicy chicken which I paid extra for! It was disgusting and disappointing. I paid $20+ for that? Not worth it.

I just don&#39;t understand why you have to walk up many stairs or walk to the other end of the first floor to get to the elevator. Doesn&#39;t make sense when the first floor has tables but no one is seated there.
They best macchiato! Delicious alfredo as well as chicken buffalo sandwich. A bit pricey on the pasta but worth it the servers were friendly.

I feel like the food here is either hit or miss. Their menu is big and has lots of different options but there&#39;s really only a handful of times I actually enjoyed what I was eating. The prices for the food are high but the dishes are pretty big and probably too much to finish in one sitting. Honestly my favorite things from here are a couple of the pasta dishes, especially the garlic noodles or the shrimp with angel hair pasta, and the chicken Madeira. The gumbo is also pretty good. If there&#39;s anything here you should get it&#39;s cheesecake. They&#39;re all rich and delicious, the slices are pretty big. I&#39;d say avoid coming here on Sunday&#39;s, service can be verrrrryyyy slow. Otherwise an okay place to grab a bite.

My wife and I had spent a couple of hours last night near Noble Square for an event. We were a bit hungry but didn&#39;t want to drive to Logan Square or venture east and wait hours for a table. We opted for Cheesecake Factory since it&#39;s on our way home and it was rainy out. Best decision since there was no wait and we enjoyed pork sliders and an ample slice of banana cream cheesecake. The sliders were served 4 on mini buns that were butter toasted! Very tasty although we could have used more bbq sauce. The cheesecake was flavorful with just the right amount of banana slices and cream. Our server could have been more attentive but all an all a good unexpected visit.

Ordered the lettuce Thai wraps did not get the sauces spoke to Manage Mr Gordon at the Skokie location never going back. This was ordered for my son&#39;s birthday he did not seem to care asked me to come back and pick up the sauce without any apology.

Love the Tuxedo cheese cake! I&#39;ve tried the skinny menu and regular menu they offer a wide range of menu items. The portions are huge in the regular menu, it&#39;s always enough for me for another meal, or come with a friend to share and get desserts! Oh and the the bread!! YUM!

I spent $150 on 5 entrees varying in price from below $10 to $20, three strawberry lemonades, two beers, tax and tip.  The price shouldn&#39;t surprise me, because we all know Cbheescake Factory is pricey.  <br><br>It was my daughter&#39;s 18th birthday and she choice Old Orchard&#39;s Cheesecake factory because she loves the atmosphere and it has something for everyone. I agree with her. My issue is that people choose to come to this high-end chain in an area with lost of high end chains to choose from.  It would be nice to have a little appreciation from the restaurant that they were chosen.  It would be fantastic to see smiling faces and staff/managers that know you chose them out of all the other places you could have gone too. It would be nice to pay $150 and know that everyone in the establishment is going to go above and beyond to show you that they get it - you could have gone somewhere else and you chose them.<br><br>That&#39;s where was the ball dropped.  It was my daughter&#39;s 18th birthday and we told our waitress and there was barely a response.  18 is a big deal - it would have been nice to feel that Cheesecake factory knew what a big deal it was that we chose to celebrate at their establishment with a menu of cocktails and meals that are well into the teens cost wise. <br><br>My daughter didn&#39;t realize it until today when she said &#34;Hey - Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t offer me a piece of cheesecake or even sing happy birthday to me!&#34; It&#39;s a good thing that she doesn&#39;t like cheese cake!! (yet she does like your restaurant and chose you to celebrate a milestone birthday.)<br><br>The one plus, and the reason we do visit you occasionally is that your food is good for the most part.  We ordered two burgers, the Chicken Alfredo pasta (the most expensive dish!!), the taco lettuce wraps (a great deal at $8) and the shrimp jambalaya.  The jambalaya was actually less expensive than the Alfredo pasta, but we all agreed that is was the blandest dish on the table. The burgers had great flavor.<br><br>Another plus for the evening was that we only had to wait 10 minutes on a Wednesday night. So, if you are a Cheesecake factory lover, but hate the wait, try a weeknight at around 7pm - left someone else deal with the weekend madness!

Service was outstanding, food exceeded my expectations and prices were totally reasonable.  I&#39;d give 5 stars except there&#39;s no waiting area.  They&#39;d make a killing off of bar service and maybe a few pub tables to sit at while you wait.  Instead it&#39;s more like a 20min mosh-pit orholding tank.  I&#39;m sure I&#39;m not the first to complain about that...right? (And they don&#39;t take reservations or phone heads...)

Cheesecake Factory, oh sweet indulgence of mine on semi-sweet occasions; February 2nd being one in particular. The wait is not terrible and the service is a hit-and-miss, food is good but not amazing, just average. Nevertheless, we have always had a great meal the few times we&#39;ve gone. It&#39;s become a tradition at this point. The four things you MUST have at any Cheesecake Factory; Bread, Fried Mac &amp; Cheese Balls, Raspberry Lemonade, and Cheesecake. I recommend the red velvet cheesecake, but that is just me. The pasta entrees are probably my favorite, although their orange chicken seems to be descent too. Chain and all, I&#39;ll be back, every year! :)

I always come in a lot this time of the year, specially when I have people out of town visiting, and always have a good experience, except this time was different .<br>I ordered the bistro shrimp pasta and  this time they did not offer the FRESHLY grated Parmesan cheese, and when I asked for it the server brought me this Parmesan out of a box you buy at the supermarket and it looks like sugar, you get the idea , I asked the server what happened and he just gave me this vague answer that did not make any sense.<br>Service was just okay, waiter seem to have forgotten about us ... coffee was not hot .. overall: not the same place I used to love .. food quality went down, don&#39;t think I will be coming in again .

If I could give negative stars I would.  Had to order through Door Dash to get delivery.  In the time of Covid-19, not willing to venture out if we can avoid it and we are trying to be socially responsible.  With that said, food was delivered late.  Only good thing I will say is they, Door Dash, kept me updated.  Anyway, food arrived COMPLETELY cold and inedible.  Both sons order spaghetti and meatballs and neither could even get a knife through them bc they were so hard.  Husband&#39;s chicken was small, but even worst, gristly.  Korean cauliflower was mush.  On top of ALL that, they didn&#39;t even send my salad.  When I called CCF directly, they told me they&#39;d be happy to make my salad, but I had to come pick it up‍.  Pretty sure that defeated the whole Shelter in Place attempt.  &#34;Manager&#34; was beyond unhelpful.  I had to contact DD directly to get any absolution.

Ordered to go- disappointed in over fried texmex egg rolls, also there&#39;s usually corn and black bean in them there want at all- for an item I typically order often came out terribly. <br><br>Tried the orange chicken$17.50 plus for this one order disappointed in this &#34;specialty  entree&#34;<br><br>Wouldn&#39;t recommend either.

The service by an older man named Ish was incredible as was the food.<br>I had not been here in well over a decade but I will definitely be back.<br>The Thai lettuce wraps, which my fiancé had never had, were so good I now have to make them for her.<br>All the food and drink was outstanding and relish the opportunity to get back as soo  as possible.

I don&#39;t know why here&#39;s 3 stars. <br>I like this place... price, food, atmosphere... etc. everything is  good!<br>Only one problem sometimes you have to wait 20-30min to sit there. But it only at Saturday evening. Not a problem actually;). Thank you!

I have to tell you I&#39;ve been to 1 million cheesecake factories. One of my favorite restaurants. This was the most unacceptable evening I&#39;ve ever had last night. There are so many things it will be difficult to list. My son thought there was mayonnaise on his sandwich and the manager came with a nasty look on her face and said well there isn&#39;t. We ordered medium rare steak medallions and they were well done. We ask for a salad to be added on in the middle of the meal five minutes later and it was with us in five minutes so they didn&#39;t listen to the directions. My aunt didn&#39;t receive Her appetizer to well after we were served our meals. One of the servers who had curly hair in a ponytail had such a horrible look and face it was unacceptable. Just wanted you to know. It also took forever to get our plates removed from in front of us and we never got refills on drinks unless we asked. I really don&#39;t want to go on anymore but you can imagine how horrible this was.

I know it is just the cheesecake factory but I must say this has always been one of my go to spots. They have almost whatever you are craving on the menu, the food is always very well prepared, and has yet to disappoint me. In all my years as a customer, I have never had a bad experience here. The table service is prompt and they pay close attention to their customers. The only bad thing would be that it can get pretty crowded at times and the wait times can be very lengthy. At times I wonder why they dont take reservations. I think that is one issue that puts a damper in things but the cheesecake definitely helps you forget all about it so I guess it&#39;s a wash. I am always very satisfied with every visit.

I admit to this being my first time at The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>On a girls night out, we met for an appetizer and glass of wine before heading to a play at Northlight Theatre. It was extremely crowded, but we still managed to get right in, and our server was right there ready to take our order. <br><br>Aiming for a light bite, and completely overwhelmed by the beyond ginormous menu, for some reason my eyes landed on the Southern Fried Chicken Sliders. I figured it would be fairly small, so I added fries for $1 for all of us to share. <br><br>Holy chicken! The appetizer portion was a legitimate meal. Take note, the portions are huge here, and I had no idea what to expect. I also expected my chicken to be pretty basic, but can I just tell you? I enjoyed every bite, and it was so good I fought hard to finish it. The plate came out with sliders piled high and a huge portion of fries. It was really pretty hilarious. <br><br>The chicken was tender and lightly crispy with a nice buttermilk batter. The buns were toasted with butter (yep, pretty rich), and the fries were perfectly crispy and seasoned just right. I fully admit that I&#39;m craving the chicken right now. I eat a lot of chicken, and I have to say this was a memorable meal...and I mean meal. <br><br>Yep, I&#39;d go back again, and it&#39;s an ideal location to stop before a show at the North Shore Center of The Performing Arts.

Comparing this restaurant location to the one in Woodfield, I would say this one is far superior.<br><br>We came at 6:00 on Friday, and we were immediately seated. In Schaumburg, the restaurant is smaller, and there is often wait times to get in. I believe the decor is classier, and feels much more upscale then the Schaumburg location housed within the mall. We were seated upstairs and had sole amount of space- not crammed into next to a ton of people.<br><br>Our server was attentive and came by us multiple times to ask us how we were doing and if we needed anything.<br><br>Since this is a chain, the food is pretty standardized... However the chicken Madeira that they boost about... It is truly phenomenal. The chicken is moist, and has very good flavor. My description wouldn&#39;t do it justice...It&#39;s something you just have to try for yourself. <br><br>All in all, a solid place for dinner  out within Old Orchard.

Once again, not disappointed one bit. The food here always hits the spot. And the cheesecake at the end is a treat well worth waiting for and the end of a big meal. <br><br>  Well again, another review I should have posted before. So please forgive me on that behalf. I visit here &amp; other Cheesecake Factory locations when I can. Just because I know that I will always be satisfied with the service as well for the meals. <br><br>  On this particular visit. I found myself venturing in to new taste. Such as the soup. I usually choose to have a salad before the main course. But this time I did the opposite, and went for their soup. And let me tel you, that must have been one of the best restaurant soups I have ever had in quite sometime. So FYI, don&#39;t pass up the soup if it&#39;s offered. You will not be disappointed. <br><br>  Please forgive me on forgetting the names of the entrées. But I&#39;m sure if you show the waitress or waiter the will know what it is. <br><br>  My pasta with chicken was delicious. My wife&#39;s salad with fish was the same. We enjoyed them so much that we tried to hold back as much as possible so we would be able to take them home to have for the next day : )<br><br>  So if you are reading this review to try and make a decision on where it is that you and a family member or friend would like to dine. Do not over look this place. The variety of different options they offer is great. And on top of that, let&#39;s not forget about the cheesecake. It is one of those delights you find yourself cheating on your diet for ; ) I know I do.

I will start off my saying that the food was relatively good. I do not have much to complain about on that end but the service was absolutely horrible. First off after being seated I politely asked to be moved into any booth, they decided to make a really big deal about it and basically told me it was not allowed. After I got a hold of a server I was finally able to get seated in a booth. It really was not packed at all but it took them over 25 minutes for them to get my appetizer and after that they took another 35 minutes to take my order. I waited a bit over 1 hour to get meal and still nothing. At that point I just gave up on waiting and was ready to leave since I had an appointment coming up. I could not find my waitress so I went up to the front desk to ask if I could pay for my meal. She rudely answer with, &#34;I&#39;m not going to be able to help you, how about you find someone else&#34;. I asked her who I should talk to and she responded with, &#34;Go sit back down and wait for your waitress&#34;. At this point I was extremely frustrated because I spend over 10 minutes waiting to see my waitress and I had to leave now. I decided to walk around and see if I could find her and that is when the manager came up to me. I do not feel like he handled the situation too well. I felt like I was being accused of trying to leave without paying because of his aggressive and rude tone. At this point about 1 hour and 15 minutes had passed since I ordered my meal and they were seemingly trying to stall the payment. Then my waitress came up to us and told us that our meal was finally ready and she would just box it up really quick. I waited an extra 15 minutes just to get my meal to go. All in all I had a really bad experience with the service there and I am definitely not going back to this location. The only thing I want people to take away from this is if you plan on going here just plan on throwing away about 3 hours of your day.
Great place for dessert or dinner. We had dessert and the cheesecakes were amazing. Big pieces and so yummy. Better than anything you can get anywhere else.

The meatloaf Is the best one I have ever tried! I always get this dish! However last year I found out that I was allergic to mushrooms! And ur meatloaf comes with a mushroom based gravy how sad! Why can&#39;t u make the gravy with out mushrooms!? Who&#39;s Decision was it to make it with mushrooms

I hate chain restaurants that serve portions that could feed a small army. But I had a gift card and thought I should use it. I really am surprised at the amazing service we received. The bread was so yummy. The menu is overwhelmingly massive that is made me want to choose nothing and leave. It is a book. A long one. But the friendly server broke it down for me and made great recommendations.<br>I don&#39;t know if I will return but I do recommend this restaurant. It was great. The food was great, as well. I didn&#39;t try the cheesecake because, well, the massive portions. But if you are in the area, it is a good choice!

I&#39;ve really been messing up going to Cheesecake Factory recently. I&#39;m blaming it on just ordering poor items off the menu. <br>I ordered the key lime cheesecake to come out first, so I wouldn&#39;t be full by the end of the meal and I could eat it throughout the meal (genius idea, in my opinion). I also ordered the goat cheese and beet salad along with the crispy crab wontons. Clearly, I wasn&#39;t feeling in a healthy mood this fine lunch and tried to make myself feel better by ordering a salad along with dessert and a fried appetizer lol. <br>The goat cheese and beet salad - delicious. The only thing I take points off is for their plating style. It&#39;s so, &#34;meh.&#34; I feel like they could plate it a little nicer. <br><br>Then, the crispy crab bites come out. At first I thought it was my mistake ordering, but no, I remembered adding in the &#34;wonton&#34; part in my order request and pointing to the words as I said them. The waiter was apologetic and that&#39;s not why I gave 3 stars. He was really nice about it, gave the table the bites no charge and went to go put in the wonton order. Since I tried the bites, I personally did not think they were good. He compared them to an appetizer favorite, alongside avocado egg rolls. They tasted fish-y to me and fell apart too easily. <br><br>But, back to the wontons that finally came out. Ugh, I was so disappointed. I&#39;ve gotten these before at another location and they were delicious! These, though, the filling was neon yellow and it tasted very mustard-y, so I&#39;m assuming that&#39;s what the yellow is from. I was so sad. I wanted to love them again. <br><br>One thing I didn&#39;t like about the waiter was that he took forever to come back to our table between each time. Don&#39;t get me wrong - he was really nice. It just took a while that we had our credit cards waiting when the check came, so we wouldn&#39;t have to wait for him to come back around again.<br><br>Okay, well that&#39;s my Cheesecake Factory rant. This will not stop me from coming back. I&#39;ve gotten delicious items from this menu, I&#39;ve just been off my culinary game, I guess, for the past couple of times.

Used to come here all the time but then they changed there menu and everything i liked was different so we stopped coming.then last week we took another chance and decided to give it another try again after years of not being here they had the food i liked once again and it was just like the way i loved it before all there dumb changes so me and my family been here twice in 2 weeks  the staff are always friendly and attentive we had thomas as our server he was very knowledgeable and attentive to our needs and super friendly and worked hard jts always busy usually a wait but well worth it  ask for thomas you&#39;ll be glad you did.
Our waitress was short and had dark hair in a low bun. She made us wait forever for the check. Horrible service.

Met up with high school girlfriends from 17 years ago. Being that I live in Texas, I haven&#39;t been to Old Orchard in so long, it was nice to visit the old stomping grounds &amp; meet in familiar territory. Our server was amazing, so funny, attentive, persuasive and friendly. Gave great recommendations, was patient &amp; made is feel so comfortable we stayed until the lights came on. I love the brown bread and joined my party fairly late, our server Mr. Cheesecake brought out a basket for me without hesitation. I was indecisive between 2 meals &amp; let him choose &amp; he brought a really good choice (Jamaican salt &amp; pepper shrimp)  that I was pleased with. He checked on us in a healthy timely manner that wasn&#39;t pushy &amp; boxed our meals before we had to ask. He offered us dessert without pushing &amp; didn&#39;t rush our check. He even updated the check when a member of our party arrived late without a hitch. This was a very good visit &amp; we were all pleased with our meals. Made a visit home that much more memorable.

I like the food at the Cheesecake Factory<br>I will go back.<br>That being said, I&#39;ll never go to this location again.<br>Who ever designed this restaurant had no clue how difficult they made it for a handicapped person.  The first floor was totally unused.  In order to reach the hostess stand you have to walk the entire unused first floor to the back of the restaurant to an elevator.  Go up to the second floor.  Walk the length of the restaurant to the hostess stand in the front.  And of course when we were seated it was up another small set of stairs back by the elevator.  I made 4 laps of the restaurant before even being seated.<br>Food was good.  Server was nice, but very slow.<br>I&#39;d go back, but not to this location.  <br>Looking inside it looked as if the restaurant was closed.  If you didn&#39;t hear the people on the second floor you&#39;d never know.<br>Very poorly used and designed....

I am absolutely OBSESSED with the spicy chicken chipotle pasta(I take the chicken out since I&#39;m vegetarian) but it&#39;s AMAZING ,I wish I could eat it everyday! I&#39;m a huge fan of the vanilla bean cheese cake &amp; the Oreo cheesecake I definitely recommend them both!!!
Love their bread, rice, and cucumber lemonade! Their Jamaican dish was okay. Service however was really great!

I&#39;ve been mulling over writing this review as I was disappointed with the level of service my group received.<br><br>First of all, our waiter didn&#39;t listen to our order and we never received the spring roll sampler.<br><br>When my mother asked for it when our entrees arrived, our waiter had the audacity to say that we ordered a lot of food.<br><br>As a paying customer, we can order as much food as we want without your commentary in our faces.<br><br>He said he would  bring it out but I just found his demeaner offensive.  <br><br>He never followed up with replenishing our waters.<br><br>Since it is a chain restaurant specializing in cheesecake, that was the only memorable part of the meal other than the offensive customer service.<br><br>The spinach dip chips tasted bland and stale.  The pasta had no flavor and the bacon in the carbonara seemed overcooked.<br><br>I would not come back to this establishment as there are other options to eat around this area.

Thanks always open late and something to eat from light to heavy. I got tired of Cheesecake here (sorry to say this), but I love to keep coming back for meals. <br><br>[LOVE] <br>+ Super antioxidant salad (surprise you&#39;ll be very satisfied!) <br>+ Thai lettuce wrap (not appetizer! It can be entree!!)<br>+ Pasta napoletana (good for left over lunch)<br>+ Grilled Salmon (not very special, but always good!)<br>+BLT salad (please make your way baaaaackkk!!!!! Love you!!!)<br><br>[Not Good]<br>+ Sweets including any cheesecake and tiramisu (I know it sounds ridiculous, but not for me. They are way to sweet and heavy. They need to work on more lighter sweets like soufflé, baked cheesecake, panna cotta, etc)<br>+ Espresso drinks &amp; coffee (so sad)<br>+ Tacos (always cold... Why?)<br><br>They have lots of varieties for meal choices. Americans, Mexicans, Italians, and Asians! At my recent visit for lunch, I finally got ahi tuna! I mean seared tuna tataki salad. I&#39;ve been asking for it more than one year at dinner time, but they always said out of tuna today. I liked tataki tuna itself, but I wish they mixed tomatoes and avocados together with greens. I feel like they are left a part. <br><br>I wish BLT SALAD will come back to menu. I felt in love with it at my very first visit at the Cheesecake Factory. It was so memorable, delicious, and of course so fresh!<br><br>Very clean and moody atmosphere, but good for family too! Service is always good :) Good for date night and special celebrations, but I just come here maybe once in a month or two months for varieties of food! <br><br>*Suggestions<br>Besides BLT Salas&#39;s coming back to menu and working on new lighter desserts, I wish Sunday brunch would be available on Saturday, too! Make it Weekend brunch please!! Because I was looking at the brunch menu which was attractive and came on Saturday brunch and realized it was only for Sunday :(

celebrated family member during covid19 with carryout lunch meal celebration.  ordering and pickup was simple. order correct and food from Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta, Chicken Bellagio,  Pasta Da Vinci, and Smokehouse B.B.Q. Burger were good. plus,we rec&#39;d plenty of bread w/our meals.

We decided to go to the cheesecake factory on December 16 for my birthday as we have done in previous years because normally the food is good. But this year unfortunately was very disappointing, I ordered a filet mignon butterflied, and my guests ordered Carne Asada, and Pasta. To begin, the fillet mignon did not look like a fillet mignon at all ! this is not my first time eating one, and it was extra fatty and very very salty. The Carne Asada was salty as well. I really don&#39;t like to complain in the restaurants because I don&#39;t eat them thinking I want a free meal, but I did inform the server, which then she informed the manager and he came over to talk to us. I informed him of the saltiness of the fillet mignon, and he claimed it was the Au jus of the fillet, and I also expressed that I never had a fillet mignon with any fat before, let alone this much! Very disappointing, and must say hat will be the last time a step into a Cheesecake Factory in my life. Here are pictures of my plate, and be the judge of my fillet looks like a mignon, I don&#39;t think so, it was more like a skirt steak that they wanted to get rid off.

THEIR CHEESE CAKES ARE SOOOOOOO GOOOOOOD! Definately living up to their name. It is a nice place to have dinner, but also a nice place to drop-in to just get a dessert and a drink. My boy and I really enjoy this place and we love stopping by when we go shoppin at the mall.

I was with a group of 4 for a Bday dinner on Tuesday. Service has really declined at this location. It wasn&#39;t even that busy. Our appetizer never came so we had to ask to get it removed from the check. I had to walk to the serving area or bar to get drinks and water after the food came. It was pretty bad - will avoid this location. They should have at least comped the Bday individual their drink or cheesecake given the experience. Manager never came around once either. Disappointing, I&#39;ve always liked Cheesecake Factory.
The hostess Serena was awesome! Great customer service, I would&#39;ve come back just for her. There was a cockroach in my soup. Hmmm so yummy! There was a nat in my chicken piccata.

We came in with a very large table on a reservation.  Our waitress was great. One of our plates came out very late because of a problem with the kitchen and they charged us full price. We were charged twice for one beer. When I called to ask about it the manger was short with me, put me on hold for 10 minutes while he talked to our waitress and came back with an attitude saying that we were given both beers when were not. 2 Lagunitas IPA&#39;S were 14.50. The food is over priced, the drinks were extremely over priced (12.50 for a watered down sangria). I could have over looked alot if we weren&#39;t given attitude when we spent over $600. Never giving this company any more money.

Well......tonight is the last time my family will be ordering from Cheesecake Factory. We have noticed the quality of the food going down over the past year or so. And ordering our dinner tonight sealed this decision. We ordered (for pick up) shrimp scampi pasta, farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic and the cajun jambalya pasta. The cajun jambalaya had a good flavor but everything was greasy. They changed the shrimp scampi pasta recipe (I called the restaurant to see if they changed the recipe and they indicated they did) and the sauce no longer has the roasted garlic. This dish also lacked any flavor and was greasy (buttery). The farfalle (which used to be one of my favorites) recipe also changed. There was no roasted garlic but carmelized onions. One would think this gave the recipe flavor but did not at all. The farfalle pasta was soooooo buttery and greasy and had no flavor at all. Just a butter taste. All 3 of our pastas had the same theme: Super greasy and buttery. Tonight is the last night we are getting food from Cheesecake Factory. We also ordered a slice of cheesecake which seems to be smaller and smaller (and at almost $9/slice, that is ridiculous). Our 3 pastas and slice of cheesecake was $77 and was terrible!!!

I spent a day shopping at Old Orchard Mall and stopped in here for early dinner as we were starving. We were seated right away in a back table as all the booths were already taken. We had a drink each, a margarita served in a martini glass and a frozen peach drink that tasted more like orange than peach. We got the fried avocado appetizer, which is tasty, but overpriced for the amount of food served. It took them forever to bring the appetizer, so we stuffed ourselves with the bread. Finally our main dishes came. It was the bistro shrimp pasta and the eggplant parmesan.<br>The bistro shrimp pasta was very garlicky and my eggplant parmesan tasted like mozzarella sticks. It had mostly cheese and barely any eggplant. I guess they just want it to taste good so they stuff it with 90% cheese. I was disappointed by this. If I wanted mozzarella sticks I wouldn&#39;t have ordered eggplant parmesan, but asked for mozzarella sticks instead.<br>Portion size is huge and we took leftovers to go.<br>On our way out, we did buy a slice of cheesecake each (tiramisu &amp; hazelnut one). We wanted to try it and see if it lives up to the chain&#39;s name. At this time the place was a crazy house. There was a huge line for the cheesecake and take out orders. The hostess stand was surrounded by hungry irritated folks waiting for a table. There was yelling, shoving, etc in the upstairs foyer area. A complete mess! I dont understand why they dont use the entire first floor? Also the restroom is tiny and dirty!<br>To top it all off later that evening we felt so heavy and our stomachs were upset from the food we ate. It was way too greasy and fat. I think they make everything in butter and I never cook with butter, but rather a bit of olive oil or canola oil. This was so greasy that it was making our stomachs go crazy.<br>I will give them the two stars for the cheesecake. It was really good and the only thing that I would step in here for again. But at 900+ calories and at $7+ a slice, you expect it to taste good.<br>Overall just an overpriced chain for very basic food.

Do you ever sit and think about where you&#39;ve dined and wonder where the food/kitchen was sanitary and where it wasn&#39;t? Well this location is definitely one of those places where you&#39;d be horrified to see the conditions. I last visited this location years ago and it was great- I loved it! I visited again on Saturday 9/7/2019 and I was extremely disappointed. First red flag was the bathrooms. They were so disgusting that my friend and I decided to wait to use the restroom somewhere else. We were seated under a table with lights that were flickering so badly, it could give you a seizure. We were moved tables, the manager made a comment about how much better this new table would be since &#34;the lights above the table had gone out completely anyway&#34;. They brought my friend a Coke and myself a Whiskey Smash. My friends Coke was so unbelievably flat, tasted so sweet with no carbonation. They replaced her drink and the 2nd Coke was not much better. I am sitting there drinking my drink and I noticed a FRUIT FLY in my drink. I call the manager over and ask that our orders be cancelled because we are leaving. The manager was rude and implied that the fly &#34;had JUST flown into my drink&#34; when it had clearly been served with the fly. He did not apologize or even offer to replace my drink. The place was in obvious need of maintenance and I can tell the bars were not kept up with, their drinks were flat and the stations were dirty. I could only imagine what the kitchen looked like/ how the cooks handled food so in good conscience we could not dine there. I wish I had taken a picture of the fruit fly. Save your money and go dine at any other place in the Old Orchard mall, which will surely leave you more satisfied than wasting your money on a disappointing meal.

I met someone here for a business lunch. <br><br>Lunch time is a zoo here. Very busy - folks actually lined up outside waiting for the doors to open at 11:30.  Even though it&#39;s really busy, the service was very good and we didn&#39;t feel forgotten, nor rushed. <br><br>For lunch I ordered a burger, medium rare and my friend ordered their Asian salad (I forget the exact name).   They came out pretty quickly. My burger was a bit more medium to medium well, but still juicy. It was a good amount of food. <br><br>My real complaint is that I ordered a side of cole slaw, which tasted great. It was served in a dish that must have just been taken out of a dish washer. It wasn&#39;t warm. It was hot to the touch. I was worried that the cole slaw wouldn&#39;t do well. After I tasted it and then felt the dish, I just had one more spoonful and didn&#39;t touch it again. <br><br>Because it was a business meal, I didn&#39;t want to derail our conversation, so I didn&#39;t say anything. <br><br>My friends salad was huge and he really enjoyed it. I think they did a decent job. I&#39;d be careful about how they serve the cole slaw. That was a real miss.

Came with my family and I had a firecracker salmon and Chinese Asian salad. The sauce was a bit salty on both but overall was very good. Came here for cheesecake of course and did not disappoint at all. <br><br>I forgot his name but the server was attentive and gave us great service. Will be back for sure

Saturday we were invited to lunch by our friends to The Cheesecake Factory in Old Orchard.  It was good to spend time enjoying the company and the food.  <br>The restaurant itself has a nice ambiance.  The food was pretty good.  I had the herb encrusted salmon w/mashed potatoes &amp; asparagus spears.  Our friend also ordered a side dish for the table of pasta carbonara (delicious heart stopping food).  The cheesecakes looked very good too, but unfortunately I didn&#39;t leave any room for dessert.  Probably just as well as I don&#39;t need to gain more weight.  <br>The herb encrusted salmon - 4 stars<br>Mashed potatoes - 3 Stars<br>Asparagus - was good, but only 4 asparagus spears (come on) - 2 Stars<br>The food is decent the ambiance is nice.

Way too overpriced for the easy-bake oven food they&#39;re serving here. I got the honey-truffle chicken and it was literally, just fried chicken with oil on top. Probably won&#39;t be back for a while.

I was very excited to order from one of my favorite restaurants but after what happened, I may not be picking up from this location again. We placed a fairly large order on a busy day (Mother&#39;s Day). We were told it would be an hour and a half and so we waited. When we went to pick up our food, they had no recollection of our order. I was in the room when I heard my mom order and she gave them her name AND phone number but when my sister went to pick it up there was no evidence of us every ordering. We double checked the phone to make sure we had called and placed an order at the right location and we definitely did! <br><br>Anyways, my mom called to figure all of this out and the woman on the phone was completely rude and didn&#39;t want to let her talk to the manager. When we finally got ahold of the manager he apologized and was very kind and helped up and retook our order and put a rush on it so we could have it within 30 minutes. <br><br>When my sister got home with the food after 2 and half hours of waiting, WE WERE MISSING OUR CHEESECAKES!!! The best part of the meal. :( we were even charged for it..!!! <br><br>So disappointing...
Food was OK, nothing to be over impressed. Catherine is such a sweet lady. She made our experience better. Thanks Catherine G. For an outstanding service!

Yum-o!  Came in here for lunch and my husband and I split the Ceasar and Margherita pizza.  Super yummy - better than I remembered from my last visit a few years ago.  Seems like they turned it up a notch with both service and quality.  <br><br>I have to also mention that this place is definitely on our *new* list of go-tos since we now have a toddler to bring along our eating adventures.  Shout-out to the hostess, Rena for being accommodating AF considering that our little one was quite the hassle that day.  Needless to say, I definitely reco this spot for families!

To first start this place was moderately busy when my party of 7 arrived. We had to wait 10-15 minutes which myself and my party did not mind.<br><br>We were eventually sat at a booth and the waiter came up to take our drink orders. I ordered an old fashion and it took a whole 30 minutes to get my drink while everyone else got their lemonade and all else of which they ordered.<br><br>This was just the start of the downfall of service, my menu had a piece of chewed gum slapped between the pages. Wonderful. The table was covered in some greasy, oily substance that was not properly cleaned. The food took forever to come out. When the food did arrive it was very good but the overall experience was ruined.<br><br>2 stars. Won&#39;t return for a while.

I only give them 3 stars for the service but the food is probably 2 stars this visit. I don&#39;t know what happened to the Cheesecake Factory but the food was not their best. <br><br>They served us bread right away but it was super tough. There were 6 of us and our jaws were hurting from chewing the tough bread. Our waitress was awesome, great service at this location. <br><br>4 of us got pasta dishes and 2 of us got burgers. The pasta was ok, it did not sit well in the end because a few of us went home with a stomach ache. One our burgers was served on a baguette and once again it was really tough bread to chew so the burger didn&#39;t get eaten. We didn&#39;t want to ask for a different kind of bun because we didn&#39;t want to bother our super nice waitress. <br><br>Overall, not the greatest food served this visit but we are not giving up on Cheesecake Factory.
Great food and even better service! Our waitress, Jennifer, was a delight! Super welcoming and very friendly. We recommend the Crispy Pineapple Chicken and Shrimp.

Found a piece of hair on the bun of my husbands burger. Manager did take the meal off bill and offered a slice of cheesecake on the house. Now my husband is turned off and vowed to never return.  I was under impressed with the Bistro Shrimp pasta. I had 4 shrimps in the entire dish and it was dry.

1st, my girlfriend and I ordered an appetizer that came with a sauce.. The waitress brought the app and left.. when she came back 5 min later my girlfriend asked what was in the sauce and the lady stated that cashews was in the sauce.. she never asked us if we had an allergy to nuts in which I do.. thank god I didn&#39;t ingest much sauce but who&#39;s to say I won&#39;t have an reaction later.. secondly, we had to send our food sent back to  be recooked.. it was not a good experience at all..

Even after reading all the horrible reviews, tho I have been to cheesecake factories all over the US I was a bit worried, but me and my husband actually had great service and the food was even better. <br>You either like this place or you hate it...which I don&#39;t really understand how you could hate it. Their menu is a freaking book. They have everything...Mexican,American,Chinese, it&#39;s all over the place. I love that. I like options! <br>Our sever was so friendly and it&#39;s such a beautiful restaurant! Don&#39;t get why the reviews are so horrible but to each there own! I had the chicken Madeira! So so good! The sauce was yummy and the veggies were fresh! My husband had the spicy chicken sandwich and loved it, very spicy though! We started with shrimp appetizer and avocado egg rolls which are always amazing. <br>No complaints here!

Here&#39;s the breakdown:<br><br>1. The place is huge. There are two floors. When I went (Tuesday around 8pm), the first floor was completely empty and not even in use. The second floor though, was not packed, but it was enough to feel busy.<br><br>2. Service is okay. We were placed in a corner where the waitress never walked by. It was impossible for us to call the waitress when we needed something and had to wait until she stopped by.<br><br>3. The food is really a hit or miss. I been to Cheesecake Factory multiple times in multiple states and always had a great food experience, except here. I got the Chicken and Biscuit which the waitress recommended saying it is &#34;so good&#34;. It wasn&#39;t. The portions were very off, too much biscuit and not enough chicken. The peas mixed tasted and looked like they were from canned peas. <br><br>4. It&#39;s pricey. Food can range from anywhere from $15-45, where the lower prices are salads and sandwiches. The Chicken and Biscuit were $17.95. <br><br>5. The atmosphere is awesome. Even though it is super busy at times, being placed in a booth makes it feel excluded. It&#39;s a great location for date night.<br><br>Overall, I would recommend this place IF you are willing to pay over $25 for a meal (and only 1 main course. Add in cheesecake and drinks, that&#39;s another story) and are looking for a nice atmosphere. I would look into what other yelpers are recommending for food because the waitress&#39;s recommend was pretty bad.

I will never eat food from this location again! I ordered some loaded baked potato tots to go, they came with sour cream.<br><br>When I got home to eat the food, I was completely disgusted! My cup of sour cream had a grilled onion and dozens of crumbs in it! I could not believe it!<br><br>Apparently they are either using leftover sour cream from people&#39;s plates, or they are using dirty spoons to scoop the sour cream into the container! Sickening!<br><br>The onion was in the middle of the sour cream until I moved it up top to see what it was. The crumbs were all through it! <br><br>Why would anyone use a spoon with grilled onions on it to scoop out sour cream, wouldn&#39;t you HAVE to see that beforehand? Because of the crumbs and where the onion was located, I am inclined to think this was used sour cream. How else would it get crumbs all throughout the container.<br><br>If they are doing stuff like this, what ELSE are they doing?<br><br>UGH! NASTY! FOUL!
I love the cheesecake factory because there is something for everyone there. The menu has a wide variety of options including diet friendly meals. And of course the cheesecake dessert is outstanding!

Lunch time we stop by and order a Bistro shrimp pasta love it , it has urugula and garlic sauce not heavy at all was tasty , fresh and creamy :) yummy Great flavor and fresh too . <br>We also order the HIBACHI STEAK , it comes with mash potatoes and green beans,  So if you are a steak eater or pasta eater this 2 plates are recommended.

We come to this place often. I always try something different from the menu and it always delivers. I wouldn&#39;t say it&#39;s mind blowing good, but i couldn&#39;t complain about it either. And i really like that they have such a long menu. Lots of choices.

Have eaten here twice this summer. I would rate the food as 4 stars. Pretty on par w other cheesecakes. Alcoholic drinks are a 5 star here imo. But the service is awful. Have had 2 diff waiters and both times they were rude and just didn&#39;t belong in the service industry. Tatyana D was the waitress on the last visit.

Came in for an early dinner at 6PM on Sunday.  Short wait, but no big deal. Menu is extensive and a bit overwhelming from my point of view. I am a pretty healthy eater, and while I appreciate the calorie count info on the menu, there were almost no entrees under 1,000 calories! I ordered a margarita (nothing special) and the gumbo (delicious but huge). Unfortunately it was nearly 45 mins from when we first sat down until we got our food. Once our food arrived we never saw our waiter again. My husband had to get up twice to track down another waiter/manager to order dessert and pay our bill.  No offer to comp a dessert or anything. Too big, overpriced giant portions, ho hum beverages, lousy service. If we ever come back we will grab some cheesecake and run.
Well this is Cheesecake Factory. Plenty of menu options available. Service was quick and attentive. Would go back

Overpriced, not-so-great food. <br><br>1. Setup of this place is bizarre. First floor is completely empty (almost eerily so) and you have to walk up a flight of stairs (or take the elevator) to the second floor.<br><br>2. Food is way overpriced for what you get. I dished out $13 for a bowl of chicken chili, and my food buddy paid almost $20 for a serving of fish and chips. Now don&#39;t get me wrong, I&#39;m willing to dish out money for GOOD food. $60 for a hearty meal at Avec? Sure. $250 per person at Alinea? Glad to. But for what you get, definitely not worth the price.<br><br>3. Service is good and attentive. Sometimes a bit hard to flag down your waiter/waitress, but nothing to really complain about.<br><br>4. Their famed cheesecake (I mean, it IS called the CHEESECAKE factory) is mediocre as well. Overly sweet and almost tastes a bit processed. Tried the pumpkin pecan and was not particularly impressed. <br><br>Average all around.

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory, so if you&#39;ve been before, food quality is relatively consistent across locations. They have great cheesecakes, as the name implies, with a very large variety. The bread they bring to the table, often ignored at many restaurants as an afterthought, is warm and yummy. They actually have pretty decent burgers for an &#39;everything&#39; diner type restaurant. And this location has plenty of seating.
I picked up a salad to go it was Santa Fe Chicken salad I had ONE very small piece of chicken about the size of a nickel.  Not the first time they skimp on the meat in a salad. Will never go back.

Food is always soo good no matter what I order.  I like to go on the weekend after my nail monthly appointment.  I always find a table for a casual brunch in the bar area.  The service is great and the complimentary break is delicious.  Be careful not to eat too much as you wont have much room left over for your meal.

I did what you asked and have not received a response from them. It seems as though you tell all the customers that because you know corporate won&#39;t reply. Nice tactic, more reason for me to never come back

I must have eaten here ten times but never have I enjoyed the place so much. I asked the maitre de and two other servers whether they prefer the Tuscan Chicken over other entrees. All of them said to get the Tuscan Chicken; now I know why.<br><br>It started with grilled, moist chicken which was covered with grilled cherry tomatoes, capers, broccoli, artichokes and fresh basil. The entire menagerie was doused in a balsamic vinaigrette.<br><br>The dish was filling despite being under 600 calories.<br><br>My sons could not finish their Cashew Chicken, so out of the goodness of my heart, I cleaned up after them. Their dishes were very well prepared, but much heavier. Nothing Lo-cal about them.<br><br>As always, the environment was festive and fun. I love the high ceilings, ceiling frescos and colored, spiral sconces.<br><br>The service was fairly good for a busy Sunday night, our waitress was a pleasure.

The service is terrible. The wait is always more than 20 minutes and once your seated you won&#39;t be waited for another 20 minutes. Not worth it. I came in with my little sister and the ladies at the front desk were so rude. I would not recommend coming here.

Came here for a lunch and it was best Cheese Cake Factory I been too so far. Waiter was helpful and she was friendly and very nice. Every time I go to cheese cake I get Egg roll sampler and it was great this time around like always . My meal and my friends meal were outstanding and excellent couldn&#39;t change anything about it. Really recommend this specific cheese cake factory!
The chicken salad was good, but the Korean cauliflower was full of additives, tasted like chemicals, and completely unacceptable.

I know that Cheesecake Factory is a chain, but this particular location was minutes from my place and a convenient restaurant to choose after a day at the mall.  From the Pasta category, I usually get the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic (it contains bow-tie pasta, chicken, mushrooms, tomato, pancetta, peas, caramelized onions, all in a roasted garlic-parmesan cream sauce - the pasta is usually cooked al dente, and the sauce is very thick and creamy, and very savory with the pancetta cubes, peas, and the caramelized onions); Shrimp with Angel Hair (large shrimp sauteed with herbs, lemon, and garlic, combined with angel hair pasta, tomato, and basil - the shrimp is deveined and comes with tail on - they are succulent and great with the light side of angel hair pasta; the herb sauce is very nice and has a slight tang from the lemon); or their Luau Salad (grilled chicken breast, mixed greens, cucumbers, green onions, red and yellow peppers, green beans, carrots, mango and crisp wontons, macademia nuts, sesame seeds, all dressed in a vinaigrette - the salad is very fresh, and I love the combination of the crispy wontons with the mix of the green beans, carrots, and the chicken; this also comes in 1/2 portion during lunch).  My favorite cheesecake of all time is their Pumpkin Cheesecake - it is only available from October through the holidays - we always order it ahead of time so we can enjoy it during Thanksgiving - it is creamy, and has a wonderful pumpkin flavor throughout - not too sweet, but quite decadent and a great way to finish up the meal.  Service can be a hit-or-miss, as during the lunch and the dinner rushes can be a bit chaotic.<br><br>+brown bread with soft butter (complimentary)<br>+Luau Salad<br>+Shrimp Scampi<br>+Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic<br>+Pumpkin Cheesecake

Where do I even begin. Well, I have waited way too long to get a non satisfactory meal. I had to wait about 30 minutes and by the time we were seated, it was about to close in twenty minutes. The food came out in 15 minutes which I expected since we ordered a lot. The food wasn&#39;t the best. There mashed potatoes had some hard spots. The restaurant fortunately closed at 10:15, because many people were still there. Overall I did not really enjoy my experience.

Worst service ever and this was for a cheesecake that I ordered 3 days in advance for my friend&#39;s birthday.  I told them that I would pick it up at 2:30p. I went at 3:25 to give them extra time ...just in case. It wasn&#39;t ready and then they couldn&#39;t find the cake. I paid extra for a happy birthday on the cheesecake. Of course it wasn&#39;t done. Their excuse was that they had so many cakes in the freezer b/c it was Mother&#39;s Day (I ordered mine for a Friday and Mother&#39;s Day was not for 2 more days)<br>They should have given me the extra happy birthday piece of chocolate free as a courtesy considering that I had to wait another 30minutes while they tried add the writing.<br>I will never order from here again! This just shows poor management. The restaurant need to reevaluate their system and either re-train their employees or hire new ones.<br>They need a new manager. The food and cake is not worth the poor service!<br><br>To make my experience even worse- no apology and the they threw my cake at me and was really abrupt and annoyed. I should have asked for the manager ... my problem was that I was didn&#39;t get mad but waited patiently. I asked to see the happy birthday writing and then she said it&#39;s there in the bag... poor service and she needs a lesson in customer service.  I work in the service industry and would never put up with that type of service from my employees.

Don&#39;t waste your money here unless you want a shitty attitude. Our waitress was Karla D, very slow service, didn&#39;t get a refill once, waited for check for about 20 minutes, when asked for a refill To-go she brought our drinks in glasses and separate plastic cups expecting us to pour it over ourselves, why not just pour it straight to the plastic cups from the fountain? Makes no sense.

The place is great with food and staff and server were friendly even though we had more than an hour wait before we got seated. <br>Bought a whole cake for a surprise for my sister after we ate dinner  which would have been unfrozen after 3 hours but it&#39;s still frozen. Just could not help to think if they did remove the cake the time we told them to.

I really like Cheese Cake Factory, but this location is not my favorite due to the crowds.I usually get food to go afer shopping at Old Orchard. I dined in maybe twice, but it was years ago. I really love their cheesecakes so they get points  just for that. I absolutely love their Chicken Madeira. But the service is slow. It&#39;s gets crazy busy. But when I am in the area I will be stopping in again.

This place doesn&#39;t even deserve 1 star. Ordered a salmon lunch with a side of garlic sauce. They dump everything  on the food and it looked like it was picked out from the garbage can. Horrible customer service

Came here for lunch on a friday, there was like a 15 mi wait for a table which is not too bad I guess. I had a lunch special which was pretty filling at a reasonable price.  The clam chowder soup was good, the sandwich was really good and the caesar salad...well.. its a caesar salad. Overall food was decent..service by our waiter? Not so good. I had to ask him if he was having a bad day. It seemed as if he was for his customer service skills needed improvement. Service to me goes a long way and I was definitely not impressed

Horrible service!! They had my husband and i waiting 20 min to get menu/drinks. My husband had to get the manager attention for us to get a server only reason why we stayed was because we had a gift card that was not refundable I don&#39;t recommend this place at all and they are very racist as well.Horrible place if I had the option to give it 0 stars I would.

Unbelievable. Completely unbelievable. We were sat at 3 and were not given water till 315.   Our waiter took out orders  (appetizer drinks and entree) and we waited till 415 for our entrees. We wanted a quick meal but to wait over 50 minutes for our entree? <br>The manager was so disrespectful and so unapologetic and when we told them forget the entree he just grabbed the bagged food and left. He didn&#39;t charge us the appetizer or the drinks but the way he said &#34;there&#39;s no bill, you can just go.&#34;<br>Unbelievable

There is a long line but my friend and I almost have waited for no time before we got seated. That is probably because we only have two persons but most guests are waiting for larger tables.<br>The complimentary bread is the best I have had in any restaurant, especially the dark one. <br>We ordered the pasta with shrimp and sausage and the red velvet cheesecake. We are really really full after we finished the shared pasta, but the cheesecake is so good with different layers! It is huge and I did feel very guilty after I finished it. I would definitely try the &#34;skinny menu&#34; next time.
