The food and ambiance is very good here, always plenty of parking. Our waiter Adrian was very attentive, he provided very Good service for us. He kept of informed about our food and made sure we had what we needed. We have ate here in the past and have had Adrian serve us too and he definitely makes it good for us to dine at Cheesecake. Thank you for your assistance.

Def love this restaurant...it never fails. I&#39;m usually somewhat skeptical about large chain restaurants with ridiculously long menus, but every time I come to Cheesecake Factory and try something new it&#39;s always on point. <br><br>I started out looking through the cocktail portion of the menu. Everything sounded really good, but I went with the pineapple Moscow mule. It came with stoli vodka, pineapple juice, lime juice, topped off with ginger beer, and a fresh piece of pineapple as a garnish. It was delicious and I would definitely order it again. <br><br>I got the spin dip as an app (my go to appetizer). It came out hot with fresh tortilla chips, a side of sour cream, and a side of salsa. Also very delicious. The portion size was pretty big though so be careful when ordering apps here if you want a actual entrée bc it&#39;s going to be a lot of food. <br><br>I got an appetizer as my entree bc I wanted to save room for dessert. I got the corn masa tamale cakes and they are to die for. They are also a really good gluten free option. <br><br>I obviously ended the meal w a piece of cheesecake. They have a whole two pages on the menu and the only problem I had was choosing which one to get bc they all sounded amazing. I settled w the lemon meringue cheesecake, and it was another home run. It was not too heavy (which is my usual complaint about cheesecake) and was amazing. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is a little pricey but totally worth it. The food, desserts, and drinks are amazing. Our server was also very good, checked on us a lot (but not in an annoying way), and we never had a problem trying to find him. I just wish they had a patio, but other than that I would recommend this restaurant to any of my friends.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places to go because it has so many great options to choose from! Feeling Mexican? Italian? Seafood? Chicken? They&#39;ve got it all! Some of my favorite dishes are the Factory Nachos with Spicy Chicken, Dynamite Shrimp, Chicken &amp; Biscuits and Chicken Madeira. Can&#39;t go wrong with any of them! They&#39;re so good I have such a hard time coming here and not ordering them every time, but there&#39;s so much else to try! The place is always clean in the eating areas and bathroom which is always a plus. I knocked down one star for service because our waiter wasn&#39;t very attentive.

Well the cheese cake is simply delicious. The good was just average, nothing to write home about. Our server was not very good and actually little annoying. Next I think I will eat elsewhere and just get cheesecake to go.

The wait for brunch on a Sunday was no problem for me and a gf. It is so spacious at this location and love it!!! <br><br>We put in my name and got called within 2 minutes of doing so. Our server gave us the complimentary bread and butter (so delish), and there is so much on the menu that it took forever for me to decide...so came the rescue of our server. He was so personable and funny, had to tip him well!!!<br><br>I was debating between two salads and he suggested the BBQ salad. So that&#39;s what I did and could not be any happier!! I may add they need a bit more dressing though.<br><br>Sangria was the only thing lacking here. It was by strong, tasted like a Virgin sangria. Not worth the $11 or $13 I spent.

Had a nice lunch here on Friday. My turkey burger was pretty good though for some strange reason it seemed like someone had started to cut the top bun in half and then stopped half way through not sure what that was about LOL. Our waiter was nice enough but he honestly was whispering everything he said,  we had to strain to hear him. I really like their skinnyliciouse menu great choices and all very tasty. The only change to it I&#39;d REALLY like to seem them make is instead of just saying all of these items are under 590 give the actual calorie count for each item. Plenty of restaurants do this. Le Peep lists the calorie count right by the food, Dominoes has a calorie calculator on their web sight, you can also find the calorie breakdown for Maggiano&#39;s online. For those of us counting calories and or using the point system it would really be helpful and honestly probably make us go more often.

Free parking in mall, handicap accessible ,elevator to second floor. We came for the first time for lunch and they were busy on a weekday.we must have ordered items they didn&#39;t do well . The good was their version of chicken pot stickers large with lots of chicken, not a thick wrap which some places do so they appear large, average fish and chips dinner, thick batter, not sure what type of fish they use as texture was different then she is used to, full sized chicken Santa Fa salad, lettuce was fresh , no wilted edges, tomato was what you get this time of year, had to look for the chicken, get more chicken in a McDonald&#39;s or Culver&#39;s salad , was disappointing at that price , the strawberry vanilla cheesecake and the chocolate cherry we took home was good

I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory and I LOVE this location!<br><br>My husband and I have tried many things on the menu and have never been disappointed. My favorites are the Luau Salad and the Oriental Chicken! It is all very filling, so it&#39;s smart to pick something from their appetizer page (of their novel of a menu), so you can save room for their namesake, the Cheesecake!<br><br>They have a wide variety of cheesecake options, and while I can get adventurous, I&#39;m all about the classic original. It&#39;s always good!<br><br>The staff here is very friendly and helpful, I&#39;m so surprised that people said negative things. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Old Orchard location manager very rude we had a used dirty fork on our supposed clean table. Manager came over and told me the fork was not dirty sometimes they pack the dishwasher too much and that happens....really so all your utensils are not properly cleaned cause this fork clearly on chocolate on it. Manager was so rude and didn&#39;t even apologize and got an attitude with us.

Yulinda was our server.  Super nice, big smile, quick, knowledgeable about the meals, and genuine. I took her recommendation on the Vegan Cobb salad.  It was great.  Way better than I expected. Also had the Basil capri appetizer  They got me seated right away.  In short, I will come back and order this again sometime soon. Very good experience.

Solid food and always enjoyable to come here. Huge menu with lots of delicious options. But after my last meal Id say they were losing their touch. The prices here seem to keep increasing to the point where they are now insulting.  I ordered the club sandwich which was $13.50. The chicken Madeira is 17.50 far to expensive for any chicken dish in a chain restaurant. <br>They got rid of the polenta fries which was one of our favorites. <br>We instead got the stuffed mushrooms which had no flavor. <br>The mashed potatoes were poorly made there were massive chunks of potatoes in there like they were hardly mashed. <br>Our server was unattentive and distracted and didn&#39;t bother to bring us bread until we asked for it. <br>Yes I would come back here because it&#39;s close and has a huge menu but I hope they take notice and step up their service and food quality to match their prices.

It had been years since I visited this location, I used to dine here often when I worked nearby, but on a visit last week, I was pleasantly surprised by the great service and decent food here. I think this Old Orchard Cheesecake has consistently better food and service over its counterparts in downtown Chicago and other locations. <br><br>After perusing the menu, which looks more like a phone book than a menu (lots of food options and hasn&#39;t changed a bit in years!), my friend and I both ordered burgers, she got a regular and I got a mushroom with Swiss. The well done was good, not burnt, and my side salad was decent (though I should&#39;ve ordered fries). Regular cheesecake for dessert was tasty. Our waiter was prompt and professional. Reminder that they don&#39;t take reservations. Overall, good experience.

Mr. Augustine and Mr. Hollander (management) hosted my Social Media Strategy class for lunch. Our students come from all over the world and they listened and asked questions as it applied to social media. Smiles and happiness with service and tasty food from clam chowder to hazelnut crunch cheesecake to die for. They asked when can we do this again?<br><br>Thank you for showing my class your hospitality and knowledge on social media and your fine restaurant.

Alot of people want to hate on this place because it is a chain, but let&#39;s be honest it&#39;s prb one of the better chain restaurants out there. The menu pretty much has everything covered. From brunch to asian, pastas, steaks, salads, and burgers it&#39;s a pretty extensive menu. I love the bread they give you in the begining. The wait for food can be a drag though. With the menu being so big there are some misses, but for the most part it&#39;s pretty good. I love the tex mex egg rolls. Not a big cheesecake fan but they do have a flavor for everyone! But as others have said I must agree it is not what it used to be, but still worth a visit especially for lunch or brunch.

Outstanding selection and atmosphere. Vegan dish was phenomenal. Coconut Lime chicken - sauce was delish and unique. Kept my 12 year old&#39;s palate excited (he&#39;s a cook in the making). Kids menu is superb.

I will never put a 5stars to a cheesecake factory place because their cheesecakes are gross. However the food is amazing there. Receipes are always bold comparing to what you can find in &#34;american restaurant&#34; and the food is always tasty and surprising. Menu is long so it can take you a while to find out what you want and sometimes I even think that it is a little bit expensive but the dishes are very well prepared and evrything is fresh. Portion are big. <br>Always a good address :)

I went here for a girl&#39;s night and it was great! It was strange because you enter from downstairs, but then have to proceed up the stairs to the podium where the hosts are situated and it&#39;s the only area for seating as far as I know. This was a little bit confusing when I first got there, but once I figured it out everything went well. The hosts were really friendly and helpful when I was asking about whether where I parked was alright. <br><br>I hadn&#39;t seen the girls I was with in 13 years so we spent about four hours at our table, but never felt rushed and we were able to joke around with our server - he made the night that much more fun. All of us were able to find something to please our pallets and made sure to save room for the cheesecake dessert. The variety was nice since one of the girls was on a diet and was able to find something, another girl had dietary restrictions that the restaurant was able to accommodate and I just couldn&#39;t decide between three items. I ended up with a spicy chicken pasta that was well made and the portion was big enough that I had leftovers for lunch the next day. The only complaint is that everything looks and sounds so good, it&#39;s difficult to choose.

I love Cheesecake Factory but this location is really bad. The first floor looks like it&#39;s closed but you need to go through it to get to the second floor we&#39;re the actual restaurant is. I usually order a burger, easy and tasty but it felt like the meat was not fresh and the veg was cold like it came out of the freezer. When I went there the place was almost empty (I arrived around 4pm) and you would expect the food to come fast but it took almost an hour. Again I love CCF but this location. Is really bad.

Let me start out by saying I am obsessed with Cheesecake and to give this location 3 stars breaks my heart. The ONLY reason why I am giving them 3 stars is because aside from everything else, the food was great. Came here a few weeks ago on a Wednesdays evening around 830pm. The restaurant was empty ! We had a party of 8. We were seated next to a bigger party as well, about 10 people I want to say. A party of 16 was seated behind us about 15 minutes after we sat down (I promise this is all relevant). The server greeted us and took our drinks. When ordering my drink, I had asked the server to bring out extra Cajun butter with the bread. My party had no idea what that was and they were super excited to try it. Side note: if you have not tried their Cajun butter... YOU MUST !!! IT IS A LIFE CHANGER :P. Anyways, when I asked for the butter, it was almost like I had offended my server, he gave me the dirtiest look. When he came back with our drinks we had placed our order of appetizers. took about 20-30 mins for those to come out. He took our food order a little before the appetizers came out annnnnnnnnd then he went missing. For 90 mins (I am not exaggerating) our food and our server was no where to be found. The party next to us (10 people) ordered when we sat down and were almost finishing their food. The party behind us (16 people) were done eating ! Not only are we hungry, but we are tired and want to go home. We had just finished working and this was our &#34;holiday dinner&#34;. 10pm STILL NO FOOD !!!!! No server, no manager. Finally I was able to flag down the bus boy and ask for the manager. The manager, like always, apologized and he ended up bringing our food. Dessert was on the house. After we finished our dinner we asked for the check right away, got our cheesecake and left. We got in our cars at about 1115pm. I understand if this was a weekend or at a busy time, but on a Wednesday at 830pm... cmon !!!! Anyways, I loved the food. I ordered the dynamite shrimp, tuna tar tar and the original cheesecake with raspberry puree. I hope they train their staff better because I do not wish for anyone else go through what we went through.

As others have mentioned, the food at this location has really slipped. I ordered the chicken piccata, and the pasta appeared to be reheated. It was dry to the point of being crunchy. There was also hardly any sauce on the plate to make it better. I&#39;ve had this dish in the past, and it was delicious then. Nothing like the plate I received tonight. My boyfriends pasta was luckily better than mine. <br><br>It also took a full hour to get our food (the whole visit took over 2 hours without a wait... unacceptable). Our waitress apologized several times for the wait, and then offered to refill our round of drinks while we waited. It sounded like a round on the house, but we were disappointed that we were charged for the extra drinks that we didn&#39;t really want. <br><br>We were very annoyed to pay over $100 for a meal that was bad. Won&#39;t be back.

It&#39;s been four hours and I have the worst gut rot of my life.  I came home running to the bathroom but still I&#39;m not better.  I&#39;ll try to recreate the crime scene.  The free bread can&#39;t be the cause, neither could the water.  My entree was the shrimp scampi and julienne steak---bingo.  It seemed more warm than anything, I didn&#39;t complain because the food appeared fine. I had a bite of cheesecake which I could/would/will do again.........This is my take.  I&#39;m in the minority as the entire restaurant was filled, so people like it......I just can&#39;t.

Brunch was cold, and the potatoes were over fried. The waitress, Marlene, was constantly absent. And the worse thing of all was taking home a piece of cake and finding a ONE INCH PIECE OF WOOD IN THE CAKE. Absolutely disgusting, will not be returning.

Terrible curbside pick-up experience. It took them 20 minutes to actually hand us our take out order from the time we arrived. And we arrived well after the estimated preparation time so the food was definitely ready. We parked in the designated space and called them to say we were here. We were put on hold for almost 10 minutes.  So I decided to go inside and just get it myself. Another 10+ minutes of waiting around to pay and have someone find our food. Sad!

I love coming to the Cheesecake Factory for drinks and appetizers...and cheesecake. They have a very extensive and diverse menu with large portions. I tend to order the same things because I love them so much - Buffalo blasts, avocado egg rolls, and a passion fruit margarita. Followed by one of each kind of Cheesecake. I kid, I kid. But I&#39;ve never met a Cheesecake I didn&#39;t like there.

I have been to Cheesecake Factory tons of times. Mostly for dinner so this is my experience eating there during lunch hours. I&#39;ve always enjoyed Eating here and nothing has changed that. Every time we had issues with something we were always taken care of. I&#39;ve never experienced bad service here. The food is always tasty and the cheesecake is out of this world. My only criticism is that the wait can be pretty long at times (depending on when you go) and I hate the fact that they don&#39;t do reservations on weekends - that needs to change ! Other than that I will def always come back here.

Very weird lunch experience here today. Throughout our time ordering, the server would keep suggesting smaller portions, or simply not ordering what we wanted at all, to us instead of what we were actually wanting. I ordered two children&#39;s pasta plates for my two boys and a side a fries for everyone at our table to share, and the server tried to suggest the fries would be too big. I ordered a Grilled Chicken Tostada Salad for myself, and again the server suggested it is too big for lunch and would I maybe like something on the lite menu? Then, at the end of the meal, he brought us our check without asking if we wanted cheesecake and said we probably wouldn&#39;t want dessert because (again) it was lunch time, and we probably wouldn&#39;t want any. I informed him that yes, we did indeed want cheesecake (to take home) and had the check redone. <br><br>His behavior was borderline offensive and definitely annoying. I don&#39;t need a server offering his opinion on if a portion is too big for me or my family, if I want to order something on the lite menu instead (rude!), or simply assume I don&#39;t want cheesecake at The Cheesecake Factory. I won&#39;t be visiting this location again.

When I come here and see the plethora of choices on the menu, I wonder why it&#39;s been so long since I came back (&#34;ooh!  I want to try this next time!  No, I want to try THIS!&#34;).  But the day after dining at CF, when I feel fat, bloated, and like I gorged on 2500 calories at my last meal (because I did), I know why I don&#39;t eat here more often.<br><br>I suspect I may have gotten food poisoning from the fish tacos here last week*.  Whether that dish was the source of my 2 days of living hell won&#39;t be confirmed, but what I CAN say is that I was not impressed at the length of time it took for our food to arrive.  Thank goodness for wonderful company.  Once our dinners were placed in front of us, you could tell the plates had been heated under a lamp, as they were hot, but the food was lukewarm at best.  The tacos looked as if they had been prepared 2.7 days ago.<br><br>Service was touch and go and quite unimpressive for the 20%+ we still ended up leaving.<br><br>*and I lived to tell the story!

I have tried very hard to like this location.<br>The design is awful -- having to climb stairs or take an elevator.  We just came with my son on crutches and it proved very difficult.<br>The staff is so unhelpful and unfriendly -- I have yet to find a staff member happy to be here. Everyone acts annoyed that you&#39;re here.<br>Any kind of take out is usually wrong and never ready on time.<br>Go elsewhere -- somewhere where they appreciate you as a customer.

I usually enjoy this place, but I am very dissatisfied with my portion size. When I mentioned this I was treated like I&#39;m stupid and blind. The manager was not willing to correct the situation. I usually come here for my birthday, but this restaurant has been ruined for me. All the manager had to do was bring me another portion. A $5 portion of chicken was worth losing the business of an entire family. Poor customer service and bad management.

I&#39;m not the biggest fan of the Cheesecake Factory to begin with, but I stopped by with a friend for lunch earlier last week. We were seated upstairs and got our bread and water relatively fast, and I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, which is usually pretty good (out of Cheesecake Factory offerings). Unfortunately, I was really surprised and unhappy with how salty the dish was. I couldn&#39;t decide whether I just misremembered how the sauce was supposed to taste, or they had oversalted my dish. Overall, not the best lunch experience in the world and will probably go back to avoiding the Cheesecake Factory for another year.<br><br>My friend did seem to like her Oreo cheesecake though!

It was the first time we had ever been here and it was very pleasant. We had a party of 6 and we were seated quickly and the waitress, Lashonda, was very sweet. Everything came out in a timely manner and was delicious. We had one little mishap with a burger that was undercooked, but the manager comped it and bought us dessert, too! The menu had a LOT to choose from and I can&#39;t wait to come back and try more!

We took our 12 yr old to the cheesecake factory for dinner. It was her choice for her birthday dinner. What a really nice restaurant. It&#39;s a huge restaurant so I&#39;m glad it wasn&#39;t rush hour. We may not have ever gotten our food. Not that it was slow, but when there is a rush it can be a long experience. That wasn&#39;t the case though. We had a wonderful dining evening. Our bartender was very funny and her drinks were tasteful, not watered down. She served us herself and was very personable. We had potstickers and chicken wontons for appetizers and both were very good. We were going to order another order of the wontons but wanted to save room for our entrees.<br><br>And as for the entrees, big portions. I got the American burger, 13oz cooked medium, it was perfect. My wife ordered Beef medallions that were wonderfully cooked and my daughter got a pasta dish, both were off the skinny menu. Great concept, the skinny menu. It&#39;s for folks that are watching what they eat and calorie counting. My in laws also were very pleased with their entrees too.<br>All in all we had a good time.<br>.

Came on a Saturday evening around 6PM. There was what looked like a huge wait, but we were seated in less than two minutes. (there was only 2 of us) and our waitress was attentive, prompt, and nice. Our food took a little while, but it was packed so it was expected. I ordered a passion fruit mojito and it was surprisingly delicious . For two entrees (which are really big portions), a drink, and a soda pop- the bill was around $50. The pasta is really good for leftovers the next day too!

I ordered the Americana Burger. I always order my burgers medium at restaurants and never once had any issues. When I bit into the burger, it was basically raw. I should have sent it back but I picked at it instead and filled up on the fries. Later that night around 2:30am, I woke up out of a dead sleep extremely nauseous. I ended up vomiting and having to call off work the next day. I will not be returning. Please teach your chefs how to properly prepare a burger!

Did you know the founders of Cheesecake factory created Grand Lux in Downtown Chicago? If you&#39;ve been to both, you can tell there is some relations. <br><br>Most of their food is frozen if you weren&#39;t aware of that. We asked about a couple items on their menu and they said they couldn&#39;t change it anyway because it&#39;s &#34;ready made&#34; or something. The food is delicious though! I just feel kinda sad that I&#39;m paying a lot for frozen food. <br><br>Service was above average. Our waiter did a great job of checking up on us and offering suggestions. She knew the menu very well because she knew what can and can&#39;t be modified to our liking. HUGE HUGE space! You can bring groups here and have a good time in their neat ambiance. <br><br>Yes I&#39;d come back! But it wouldn&#39;t be on the top of my list.
Disappointing kitchen cook times!  Finally got it with one gigantic chicken piece rather than the usual two separate piece and no arugla.  Place is going down in quality in my opinion.

Huge Tried menu covering everything under the sun and ranks mediocre at best in taste, great for those who don&#39;t get out much to be overwhelmed with the size of the menu, decor and <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcost.at&amp;s=3b5289820378aca2d54d5e4a662364ac8c0030af02616ec255bc91176ef452da" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">cost.at</a><br>People just want sweets and eat food to avoid looked bad.

After many years of enjoying either eating there or taking out, tonight was the third time this year of incredibly bad service and they misplaced my credit card on top of it. Thanks for all the good memories, but after three consecutive problem visits, I&#39;m done.

We stopped by for a late lunch on a rainy Friday afternoon.  The restaurant was half empty due to the weather, but there were plenty of people around.  We started with Mojitos and Dynamite Shrimp.  The shrimp was crispy and flavorful, the dipping sauce was the perfect combination.  Our mojitos were refreshing and sweet, just as we ordered them.  For the main course, I ordered the Chicken Madeira, which was prepared perfectly.  The chicken was juicy and the potatoes were creamy, the perfect meal for a rainy day.  My husband ordered the Cajun Jambalaya, I wasn&#39;t a fan of his dish, the seasoning tasted off, in my opinion.  We ended our meal with a slice of cheesecake with fresh strawberries.  The cheesecake was delicious, the highlight of our meal.
The main reason I come here is because of their &#34;Orio Dream Extreme cheesecake&#34; it so delicious!

Our server was terrible. It took us about 20min since we were seated to receive our waters and drink orders. We ordered with her right away, but our food took another half hour. <br><br>We were seated in a booth and our server kept passing our food over the railing instead of coming around which I thought was very unprofessional. I understand cheesecake isnt the most upscale place, but I have never been to restaurant where the server is too lazy to come around to give us our food. <br><br>The experience with our server completely ruined our meal.

Cheesecake Factory left a bad taste in my mouth!!<br>Two friends and I had a bridal shower at the Cheesecake Factory in Old Orchard Shopping  in Skokie. We were looking forward to spending time with our guests and the bride but instead we had to hunt down the wait staff throughout the entire shower.   I think I know the bus station better than the staff!  We had to ask for glasses for the punch, water glasses for the table, and dishes to be cleared.  Never once were the water or soft drink glasses refilled. The dessert was delayed with a lame excuse that they had to be completed (conflicting &#34;stories&#34; from wait staff and managers).  We were never greeted with even a hint of a smile.<br>We seemed to be a major inconvenience to them.  We spent close to $500 and felt we were fools for doing so.  We discussed our unhappiness with 2 managers.  Wow, are they lame!  They must be on the defensive often because they both greeted us with huge attitudes and really didn&#39;t have any concern for our satisfaction at all!  The kicker is that they even fixed the tip after taxes.  No way were we going to spend 30% on a tip for service that we didn&#39;t receive!<br>My advice is to STAY AWAY from the Cheesecake Factory if you are planning an event.

I still love this place - definitely not much of a wait which is great when you have two hungry kids.  I wish that they had something for the kids to do such a coloring page while waiting for their food, but I do appreciate their kids menu with the side of fruit.<br><br>As our first date back in 2002 was at this particular Cheesecake Factory, we returned to the scene last night in 2013 with the kids in tow.  Food was prepared well (love the size of their nachos where they don&#39;t skimp on the cheese) and brought out accordingly.  Portions are huge where we now have boxes in our fridge for perfect leftovers for the next day.  Service was great last night - loved our waiter.  Overall, I know that it&#39;s a chain but it&#39;s a solid one with large portions, good food and even better, friendly service.

Needed to change a battery in an apple phone, great time for an unrushed lunch. Snow covered mall, ready for a good lunch. I didn&#39;t get one, started off with a Bloody Mary, the garnish a piece of celery had one end black, old or used I&#39;m not sure. <br>Now my pasta with sausage and shrimp came, sausage and shrimp were good, the pasta was hard not aldente my fork cold not pierce the pasta. I will not go back to this restaurant I will not recommend bad drinks bad food poor excuse for a restaurant.

We went there about 2 yrs ago and didn&#39;t had a good experience. The food was Ok, but the waitress literally was pushy and inattentive.<br>We were celebrating our family member&#39;s birthday and Cheesecake happens to be her fav restaurant. So when we asked where she like to go...we knew her choice.<br>For a change the experience this time was very welcoming and warm. Our waiter was charming, informative and helpful and that changed everything. The food tasted more delicious and the place more familiar. <br>The Filet Mignon simply melted in mouth.My sister&#39;s Jambalaya and my husbands steak with teriyaki were outstanding too. Just the pineapple chicken was a let down, as it is just like orange chciken with few pineapple bits in there.<br>The cocktail were great and since my sister&#39;s came in a chipped glass, the waiter happily got her another one.<br>We were impressed by their option of low carb, no sugar cheesecake option!<br>We have a suggestion to make, hopefully someone insider is listening. My son and i know many kids are allergic to eggs. So if your master cheff can work on a Eggless cheesecake option...you will see us much more often.

I would love to give this place NEGATIVE stars. I&#39;m not reviewing the in house restaurant service but more specifically the take out desk. The woman at the takeout desk was extremely rude, the service was extremely slow and disorganized. I always get take out from this location based on where i live and the food is ALWAYS late the service at the front is always chaotic and they clearly have no clear contact with their delivery drivers because it appears as they fall behind on orders regularly there is always drivers waiting by the take out. I usually try to be reasonable but this is at least ten times I experienced rude, slow, inconvenient service at this location. By far the worst of any cheesecake location. The manager who oversees the takeout desk should be ashamed how terribly they run it.

I&#39;ve been here a few times for larger family dinners. I love the food especially the new menu options they just added. Unfortunately I can&#39;t say the same for the service we have received that last few times. Was just there last night and we started off the evening waiting 20 mins just for a glass of water. I&#39;ve been a server before and can tell when a restaurant is short staffed on a busy night, but no apology the entire night is just plain ignorant. I also ordered a few apps before my meal and only got one of them. Another 20 mins go by and the server finally comes up and asks if I ever got my other app, when I say no he tells me they ran out...<br><br>Everything else went fine for the most part till the end. We sat and waited again just to get dessert, I had to get up and walk to the front to get my own menu. When were ready to pay we were more than done playing the waiting game and asked another waiter to take our payment. <br><br>The issue that really put me over the edge is that it seemed that every server was more interested in closing and getting all their closing duties done than helping the customers that were there. Only reason I would ever go back is being forced to for family get togethers.
Great food and drinks, but we paid for them. Long Islands and Shepard&#39;s Pie are fantastic.
This place always delivers! Good food, service and they have my favorite cheesecake ever - everyone needs to try this masterpiece (the mango key lime Cheesecake!!)

Horrible service! This is a place my coworkers and I usually go however on this occasion staff showed no effort, couldn&#39;t get any service at prime dinner time on a Friday night. When we finally did get a waiter he was very inconsiderate and outright rude. The food was still decent which is the only reason I&#39;m giving it a two star. Will not be going back anytime soon

Decided to do curbside at 10pm. Called and was told the order would be ready in 25 minutes. When I called back the woman said hold on let me get your order and bring it out. 10 minutes later I called and she apologized saying they ran out of shrimp but found some. I&#39;m confused because if they ran out where did they find the shrimp. It would have been nice to get a call informing me of this. Inconsiderate.

I feel the servers can get a few tips on better customer service. My Fiance and I had dinner there Saturday night and things were ok til the server spilled a whole glass of wine on the both of us. so obviously the whole table had to be cleared. She kept giving us the table napkins to clean it up, never did she bring a wet towel to get the stickiness off the table. We had to, constantly, ask for our bread again, then water, then tableware. I sat through the rest of the dinner with my sleeve sticking to my skin from the wine. Her attitude was as if we just had &#34;to deal with it&#34;. It was just bad service overall.

I&#39;m done with this restaurant.  I usually have problems with service but tonight was the food and after paying $109 for it, I am no longer a customer.<br><br>We ordered to-go:<br><br>-bread and butter.  Received no butter.<br><br>-A tossed green salad with extra ranch.  No idea what dressing we got but sure wasn&#39;t ranch.<br><br>-Pasta da Vinci.  They brag that this is their most liked chicken dish or something.  It was disgusting.  I had to add salt (which I never do) for it to taste like ANYTHING and even that was a bad move because all it did was bring out the horrible taste.  The pasta obviously tasted like the water it was cooked in and it tasted like the worst tap water you&#39;ve ever had.  Then, each and every piece of chicken I bit into had some nasty cartilage or something hard in it and I had to spit it out.  I&#39;m weird about meat so it took all I had in me not to throw up on my plate.  <br><br>-2 Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp.  We&#39;ve gotten this before and it&#39;s never had chicken in it.  Today there was chicken.  Probably to cut back on shrimp and save them a buck while charging customers shrimp prices.<br><br>-Celebration Cheesecake.  Haven&#39;t tried this yet as I lost my appetite from dinner.<br><br>The best part of tonights experience was the sweet sweet girl that brought our food out to me.  5 stars for her, zero for the food. Won&#39;t be returning.

I have been to the CF 2 dozen times and I am still not impressed. The menu is way to big and  the prices for the cheesecakes are high. I do love the bread baskets and the ambiance good place for a first date.

My father came in to purchase four slices of cheesecake for my mother&#39;s birthday. He ordered and proceeded to wait 30 minutes for the slices to be packaged, while the teller completed orders for customers behind him in line. <br>After 30 min he inquired about the cheesecake, which he had already paid for. The girl scoffed and proceeded to package the four pieces laying down ON TOP OF EACH OTHER IN A SINGLE BOX AND SQUISH THE LID CLOSED, DESTROYING THE CAKE. <br>My father was obviously not ok with this and requested new slices. The girl threw a fit and got her manager, who after finding out what has happened all but ASKED MY FATHER, A PAYING CUSTOMER, TO LEAVE. <br>Absolutely ridiculous, unprofessional, disgusting behavior on my mom&#39;s birthday. Will never go to this place again and will warn others that the staff are incompetent, haughty and ridiculous.

Came here for one of my birthday celebrations ( I had a few). I sat in the dungeon (literally all the way in the back and around the corner). Our server was nice but our table wasn&#39;t constantly bussed and taken care of. Food took a long time to come out (maybe because the food runners couldn&#39;t find our table haha). Will be back, but this place is rolling down hill.

Their menu has more than 300 items on it so this review is just for the Sunday brunch service which is available only on Sunday till 2pm.  Darn it.  I wish it was an option on other days because really I see nothing wrong with a  little Lemon Ricotta Pancake on Tuesday.  Lemony and rich and sweet.  It&#39;s brilliant <br><br>Or a Baja Chicken Hash on a Wednesday! Though there were 2 generous mounds on 2 tortillas, one was all I needed.  Great balance of flavors and texture.  I don&#39;t even want to think of how many hours in the gym it&#39;ll cost me.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory, all i&#39;m saying is add one of  your Sunday brunch items as a daily special.  Would that be so terrible?  =D
If your going there for steak think twice. The steak was flavorless and really chewy. There appetizers and drinks are phenomenal. Burgers are good as well. The chicken entrees are amazing.

I went to this Cheesecake Factory with my boyfriend expecting an experience a little nicer than a regular chain restaurant (e.g., Applebee&#39;s). Should have just gone to said chain restaurant.<br><br>After we were seated, it took roughly 10 minutes to be greeted. Our waitress (who I didn&#39;t realize was our waitress at the time) went to every single table around us to deliver food, take orders, etc. She even pushed our table a few inches to the side to get in to deliver a plate of food to the people next to us. All she had to do is acknowledge us, say she was slammed, and we would have understood. Instead, she chose to ignore us and leave us waiting. Eventually she came to us and asked for our drink orders. We gave our whole order at that time, since we had ample time to decide. <br><br>She dropped off the bread first, drinks a while later. Then when we finally got the food, it was so lackluster. I had the Mexican salad with &#34;avocados, corn, chicken, sour cream, and hard tortillas.&#34; It was made with shredded lettuce, which is okay on a taco, and tasted like coleslaw. The &#34;hard tortillas&#34; we&#39;re on the bottom of the whole salad, covered in a black bean &amp; chicken mix, and they were ridiculously soggy. I ate the chicken and called it a day. <br><br>My boyfriend got the pulled pork sandwich, which was served with globs of coleslaw on it. He gets pulled pork sandwiches everywhere we go and I have never seen him so disappointed.<br><br>I was going to ask the waitress for a different entree because I was so disappointed and starving, but she never came back except to drop off the check. <br><br>Terrible service. Sub-par food. Cramped atmosphere. I will never go back.
This place is just horrible. And I can&#39;t believe how many people go there. Worst place ever. Crap food and crap service.
Amazing food! Wonderful waitresses and waiters, horrible hostess in the lobby, the most rude people hired! Dec 2018

The food was ok, the service was good. But we couldn&#39;t help but wonder if the hostess was racist towards Asians. We were seated in the very corner, almost hidden from view, even though there were plenty of tables available in the area. We asked to be reseated and the hostess even questioned if it was possible to be reseated a few tables away. <br><br>Afterwards, we noticed that another Asian family was seated in the same hidden corner, again with several empty tables around them. This was after another (non-Asian) group was seated at a nearby better table.

My wife says hey its Valentines day let&#39;s go to dinner. I say ok your choice baby where you wanna go she says Cheesecake factory, I say done let&#39;s go. I ask the server how is the fried zucchini app she said oh they are the best, I say better then Maggianos cause Maggianos has the best fried zucchini ever she said better. The Zucchini came and my wife can tell I was not happy but I ate them and told her how good they were. Next I was not able to decide if I wanted Italian, Mexican, classic American,  Irish, that&#39;s how big and out of order the dinner menu is. I decided on the Shrimp tacos and they were also terrible, no flavor what so ever. At the end my wife asked how did you like it and I said well I like that you liked it and left it at that. Will I be back oh hell no I&#39;d rather go to a 7-11 or a gas station for dinner instead.
I did take out with DOORDASH a delivery service in the area. I recommend them. It&#39;s an app for your iPhone.<br>Cheesecake Factory delivery was great the food was really delicious and hot.
The best dish! Chicken Madeira! Yummy! It&#39;s always great at Cheesecake Factory! Great food fade customer service! Love it!

I enjoyed the food here. The menu is very large. You cannot go wrong with whatever you order. I had the hamachi steak.  Also the cheesecakes are very good. A bit on the sweet side. The Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake is my favorite. It melts in my mouth.

Good food, delicious cheesecake (as you&#39;d expect) but PRICEY! The three stars are for the food and a very personable server but, why is the whole first floor empty? Honestly, if we hadn&#39;t heard people talking above us upstairs, we would have thought that they weren&#39;t open. My friend and I both have mobility issues and this place is NOT handicapped friendly. I saw no signs for the elevator so we were wandering around the abandoned 1st floor to finally find it tucked away in a dark corner way in the back. Then, after riding up in the tiny tin can of an elevator, almost standing in each other&#39;s shoes (!), we got off and had to trek all the way back to the front of the restaurant to find a server. I was tired and my friend was in considerable pain by the time we finally sat down. So to recap, good food, high prices, good cheesecake, not handicapped/mobility-challenged friendly, 1st floor spooky &amp; abandoned-looking. Just so you know...

Fancy, affordable, and delicious food! <br><br>I have to give this place four stars because it made my mom really happy. She was delighted by the fancy feel of the restaurant- the mood lighting, the soft rock playlist, the booths, and the sweet and kind waitresses. <br>A lot of people were waiting to be seated, but our wait was only 15 minutes. <br>The hostess quickly seated us, and the waitress came with ice-cold water. We asked for bread, and the bread was very soft and delicious. We wanted to ask for more, but we refrained because we wanted to save our appetites for the main course. <br><br>The menu is a whole booklet, and it also comes with a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu as well. My brother ordered salmon and rice dish (~20$), and he was impressed by the juiciness of the salmon and its tasteful marriage to the rice. <br>My mom ordered a turkey avocado burger from the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu, and I ordered a vegetarian burger from the skinny menu as well. Apparently, these dishes are under 600 calories! (Cheesecake has a bad rep for having extremely caloric food). <br>I appreciated this menu, because I hate fattening foods. Hate! Now I can still come to these nice restaurants with my family and friends :). <br>There was quite a lot of turkey on my mom&#39;s burger. The burger was more like a sandwich, because there was no patty. However, my mom thoroughly enjoyed the turkey (an inch think) and the avocado slices and the bacon slices. <br>I, on the other-hand, did not like my veggie burger. The patty was made mostly out of rice and beans. The texture of the rice did not complement the softness of the bread. I took the bun off in the end.. The patty was disappointing. I think morning star offers better patties. <br><br>However, the cheesecake is soo goood. We were full by the time we grabbed our dessert forks, but the decadence and richness of the cheesecake made us forget about our bloated tummies for a minute. <br><br>-It&#39;s a good place to go when you want to treat yourself. But be kind to your body please. Some of these dishes are more than 1000 calories!  <br>-share the cheesecake, please! for your health!

Super great food and service every time. Been there probably 12 times now. Always crowded and sometimes on the loud side but it&#39;s because it&#39;s a great place to go for food and company. Decorations are interesting to look at and literally TONS of option on the menu. Go!
I had nice dinner with my husband, interior was really nice, it&#39;s very busy place. Only thing I didn&#39;t like, my dish that I ordered was too spicy.

The Cheesecake Factory is a chain with the sort of gargantuan menu that makes your head spin. <br>Then why the hell is everything there so off-the-hook delicious? <br>I&#39;ve literally never had a bad meal at this place. Prices are good for the portions you receive, and the drinks are delicious, never watered down. Get the Thai Lettuce Wraps --they&#39;re in the appetizer section --but it&#39;s a massive plate of luscious vegetable-laden wonder with three dips, all of which entice. They plate it on large leaves of red cabbage ...which I always squirrel away in a napkin to take home, and add to my smoothies and slaw the next day. Why waste a hunk of gorgeous nutrition? <br>This trip I had the Shepherd&#39;s Pie for the first time which is sort of deconstructed in a pasta bowl. YUM!... excellent gravy, well-prepared meat and veg with a crackling potato topping ..served with a recommended Pinot noir ...heaven. <br>The one thing I don&#39;t usually have us the cheesecake, though I know it&#39;s delicious. Because I&#39;m already too stuffed with delish. Mmmmmmm.

My boyfriend &amp; I love coming here for a date night. We always try new dishes and have never been disappointed ;) <br><br>Waiting time always seems to be longer here than most places but the cheesecakes definitely make up for it. The most recent one that we&#39;ve tried was the banana cream cheesecake and until this day I can&#39;t forget the taste! Mmm so yummy !

Had buffalo blasts &amp; thai lettuce wraps along with drinks. Now I have the &#34;itis&#34;. LOL.<br>Our server, John, was GREAT!!! <br><br>Just had to note: The servers are required to wear all white, but it only looks nice IF their white clothes are WHITE without dirt and food stains. It is soooooo unappetizing to be served by someone with dirty WHITE clothing. YUCKY!!!

Best location of one of my all-time favorite restaurants. The broadest menu this side of Portillo&#39;s, an upbeat and classy atmosphere, and consistently great food make Cheesecake Factory downright legendary. The service at this location is usually great. I recall only one truly bad experience in probably about 40 visits over the past 15 or so years. For a place run by fallible human beings, that&#39;s pretty darn good.<br><br>I will forever mourn the loss of the Double Barbecue Bacon Cheeseburger, the old french fries, and more recently the Kobe beef burger. But all told, Cheesecake Factory is still one of the best places to eat, period. The bread is on my top five all-time bread list. That&#39;s a pretty coveted distinction. Bring your biggest appetite!

Cheese Cake Factory is always good place to go, nice décor, drinks and food.  But, after dining there over the past 10 years, they really need to change the menu.<br>If you have several vegetarians in your group, choices are very limited, you will end up ordering same dish due to lack of selection.  These dishes have also become under whelming over the years.  You would think as people become more health conscience that menu would reflect it!!!<br>This is still good place to dine with friends, just avoid going with other vegetarians in the group if you can!
bullshit i got like 5 little pieces of chicken in my skinnylicious turkey and avocado sandwich

This is an awesome restaurant. The choices are extensive, the portions are large, and the quality of the food is top notch. It&#39;s also great ambiance with beautiful decor and outstanding service. I just don&#39;t get the low reviews...I&#39;ve been coming here for over a decade, and it is hands down my favorite restaurant, whether for a business lunch or family dinner...this is my go to spot.

So this was our very first time here. I&#39;ve been nagging my fiancé to take us here for the longest. When we got there we had to wait for half an hour which I never mind the wait because I know how hectic it can get on Sunday&#39;s. My fiancé let the hostess know to mention to the server that it was our daughters birthday. She took us to our seats and didn&#39;t mention anything. Our server came and we ordere drinks while we looked over the menu some more. She came back and took our order and my fiancé mentioned my daughters birthday to her. She said she was going to note it. She came back about 15 minutes later telling us she had to leave so someone else would be taking care of us. So the new server brings us our food and yet again my fiancé mentions our daughters birthday and she totally brushed it off by saying &#34;Oh. Ok!&#34; and walked away. She came later with some boxes and the check. Giving her the benefit of the doubt, I thought she would bring something for her birthday after she brought the check but NOTHING. My fiancé paid she took the bill and left without saying anything else. We were leaving and there were a lot of servers singing happy birthday to this other table   Me and my fiancé just looked at each other. We were angry but I was sad for my little girl.

I am from Buffalo Grove, and I will travel all the way to the Skokie location just because of the layout. I&#39;m all about the view and the beauty of where I am sitting. This Cheesecake Factory is unlike any of the others. I love the second floor dinning. I go here quite frequently, whether if it&#39;s for meeting a friend, a date, a family sit down or just a casual noshing session after walking thru the Old Orchard Mall. I&#39;m pretty sure I&#39;ve tried everything on the menu, (they have a large selection/variety of food). I would order these avocado egg-rolls, as an appetizer, you will not regret it. I will say EVERY TIME I sit down here, the service is nothing less than fantastic. The food is always to perfection.

, Well make sure you are not too hungry when you eat at this place. I and my kids were there Friday night about 7pm. Half hour waiting for our table and then another 1 hour waiting for our food to come. Finally my kids feel so tire and sleepy and end up I have to packed all the foods home.

All these years of dining at Cheesecake but yesterday experienced a pathetic dinner: overpriced (the $17.50 seems the minimum for so-called entrees) and erratic service.<br><br>The fish and chips was actually 4 small fish nuggets and a small handful of bland, overcooked, not fresh french fries. <br><br>The pasta w/chicken and shrimp--served to our an adult man--likewise overpriced but under-portioned--the chicken and shrimp, like my fish and chips, were in the shape of teeny nuggets.<br><br>If they want to overcharge diners, then stick with adult portions to justify the policy. This was appalling and customers should be warned.

Our waiter seemed pissed off throughout our whole experience. Waited too long for mediocre experience. First, waiter brought me the wrong drink. Second they brought my girlfriends plate too cold, so we sent it back. Also when they finally brought my plate, it wasn&#39;t what I had ordered. Waited ten more minutes for both our plates to come to us.

I do love this cheesecake factory.  Unfortunately im basing this 1 star review mainly on my waitress who took more than 20% than what i put and charged my card more to get a better tip. Beware of what they charge

Come when you have plenty of time to spare because even if they&#39;re not busy, and they rarely are, you&#39;ll spend plenty of time waiting in front for anyone to acknowledge you as the staff of millennials passive aggressively ignore you. <br>The food is pretty good, the cheesecake fattening and delicious. But the waitstaff keeps me away.

On a Friday night my sister and I were super excited to have a dinner just us 2. We got seated right away which was great and our waitress brought our bread and water right away. My sister and I asked the waitress a few questions about items on the menu, in particular about the gluten free plates. She answered my sister and even suggested a specific plate. My sister ended up getting I<br>Believe something along the lines of &#34;Pineapple Curry Chicken&#34; I&#39;m not really sure. Regardless my sister was super disappointed in the food. Said it tasted weird. I ordered the Cajun Little Chicken with a side of honey glaze sauce. About 15 min into our order the waitress comes back saying the manager will have to charge me $2 extra for the sauce.. so strange so I declined. All I wanted was some sweet sauce to offset what I thought would be spicy chicken (plate said Cajun chicken). Well guess what! My plate was a bag of Tyson&#39;s plain chicken tenders with a size of mashed potatoes and corn sacatash. I did get a side of bbq sauce and honey mustard, but this was not spicy or had anything Cajun at all. I shared my disappointment with the waitress and got an apology nothing else. Super disappointed.. don&#39;t think I&#39;m going back! It also took the waitress over 20 minutes to pick up our payment. Overall super disappointing.

Thanks for making us wait half an hour at curbside service only for is to have to call again to remind them we were outside waiting.  Not only did we wait for half an hour, the food they brought us was cold!
We usually love this location but tonight the service was very slow. Very disappointed and unfortunately we won&#39;t be returning
Awesome (not to mention overwhelming) menu! There is something here for everyone. The decor is also really cute. <br>Our server Isho was amazing too! I will def. be back :)

The worst Cheesecake Factory in my experience. They have the worst carry out service. Wait to pay for your food 30 minutes after standing waiting for someone to come charge me and give me my food. Pathetic chain.

Literally I have been here like 10 times a month!! I always tired something new and loved it each time. All dishes are really delicious and bring good portion, either if you go on  lunch or dinner always get good quantity!. and our waiter was always nice to us. For a small group or big family thing, this place is great! also all cheesecake are so tasty!! loved this place..

I came here with friends to have a nice lunch and was very disappointed. First, I ordered seared ahi tuna and the waitress brung out tuna tar tar, the wrong dish. When the waiter asked what kind of rice I wanted I said white.  I had to wait an additional 15 minutes for my meal to come. When my dish came I had brown rice instead of white. I lost my appetite and sent the order back. Horrible service and very disappointed. Will not be returning

Came here for a friend&#39;s birthday dinner. Normally, I&#39;m used to fast &amp; excellent service. This was NOT the case tonight. I ordered the Chicken Costoletta &amp; it came out cold. I asked for pasta instead of potatoes but got potatoes. Did not get my asparagus so I asked for some on the side &amp; they gave me cold, hard asparagus. I asked for extra sauce, but none came. CLEARLY my food had been sitting in the window for quite some time. <br><br>In addition, my friend ordered the same food as me but the food was served on a dirty plate where there was spinach plastered to the plate..... yet there was no spinach anywhere in the dish.....? <br><br>The only response from the manager? He gave us one free slice of cheesecake &amp; gave a discount on my friend&#39;s dish yet no offered of compensation for mine. As someone whose been working in restaurants for 8 years &amp; the hotel industry, this is just NOT acceptable.<br><br>SUPER disappointed in Cheesecake Factory &amp; the management. What a poor representation of your brand &amp; customer service!!!

Yikes.<br><br>I&#39;ve been here time and time again and yes, it is a chain restaurant, but I always like the food.  Last weekend, I went with a girlfriend and the food was still good, but it was the worst service I&#39;ve had.<br><br>When we first got there, our server came by quickly and asked we were ready.  We told her we needed a couple minutes and then she left....for 20 MINUTES.  We tried to flag her down, but never saw her.  When she finally did manage to come around, we ordered two dishes and an appetizer.  We waited, and waited, and waited, and waited, for a good 40 minutes before our appetizer came out (which was served by a different server).  Then literally two bites into our appetizer, our main dishes come out.  Once again, by a different server.  Umm..what.<br><br>As we were eating, our server finally decides to come around and fill our drinks without being asked (the only perk we had all night).  Other than that, she was never to be seen, and when she came around to fill our drinks again, I quickly asked for the check, knowing she wouldn&#39;t be back for the rest of the night.<br><br>Worst service.  Bar none.  If I want Cheesecake, I&#39;ll go to a different location.
Saw a waiter picking a piece of lettuce, from a customers dish, and eat it before serving it! Disgusting!!

This place has declined so much over the past year and a half, I don&#39;t know where to begin.  I will begin with the fact  that cheesecake factory has been one of my favorite family dinner spots for well over a decade. Some of my criticism includes the Michigan Ave location. Oh and let&#39;s be clear I am not returning...sad to say. I work hard for my money and not giving it away. Hostess station seems the appropriate beginning. Now a days there is 2-3 young people hovering around, more interested in their cell phones than doing their job which is greeting those who are about to contribute to their paycheck. Imagine that. Appearance, attire, self grooming leaves much to be desired. Professionalism, seems, is no longer a requirement for one of the most important posts,&#34;greeting&#34;. Neither is service. Someone doesn&#39;t seem to understand the concept that dining is a service industry and I have thousands of options. Anger is a good word that comes to mind when you are treated as if you are disturbing them and somehow they are doing you a favor by  showing you to a table. The time previous there was 3 young hispanic women, about highschool age on a busy friday night speaking spanish and seating others arriving after us ahead of us, failing to see I also spoke Spanish and  let them know by speaking in my also native language Spanish.  This last time friday at lunch was 2 young men, equally enthralled by their cell phones. The wait staff is hit or miss Friday lunch was definitely a miss with a lady that took 15 minutes to bring our water after taking 10 minutes to come greet us. Ugh... I am already tired describing this experience.  She certainly didn&#39;t make up for the unpleasant host encounter. It was 1230... pretty early into the beginning of the day her white shirt dirty, wrinkled and unbuttoned...rolling around in the kitchen? Then I ordered my favorite spinach and artichoke dip, usually warm, cheesey deliciousness. Could it get any worse???? Artichokes were no where to be found, and did someone forget the salt???? It was warm and thank God also was the table bread. My favorite entree &#34;chicken marsala&#34; was the last draw. Barely any of the mainpart of the dish which is the savory marsala sauce..over maybe 3 ounces of the fattiest piece of chicken breast (how is that possible??) which had been pounded into a thin sheet....... flavorless mashed potatoes... because I can&#39;t eat pasta and that was my farewell to 13 years of cheesecake factory.

Our server Anna sucked!! Very mean! Worst server ever! Watch out for her! We ordered lemonade and she forgot to bring it. So I  told her u forgot my lemonade. She said, NO I DIDNT FORGET! OUT LOUD!! When she served us she always had a mean face that a server shouldn&#39;t have.

Bad.  I&#39;ve been to CCF in Edina, Minnesota and it&#39;s always been a great experience.  Here, I was like, &#34;is this the same chain?&#34;.   We were a group of 8.  Food was really bad (dry pasta, poor pizza, questionable shrimp, etc). The server was overwhelmed, looked stressed and upset. Then, when we were leaving, the manager was publicly segueing with another guest.  Bad.   Really bad. I was so upset.

Food  was delivered on time but food left an awful taste in my mouth and gave me an upset stomach . Their quality of food used to be way better . I ordered the chicken picatta and it was too buttery and oily , I had an upset stomach till the next day .

I think what&#39;s most upsetting about writing this review is that the Cheescake Factory of the 90&#39;s in the Chicago area is not what it is today.  Today it&#39;s like an old tired restaurant that stopped trying.  I was at the Skokie location twice in the last few months and one time it would have been on about a 3 star level in terms of food and service and the most recent really took a plummet.<br><br>Mimosa&#39;s ordered for the table.  On the weak side and the strawberries in there looked as if they sat around for a week or so.  But hey, alcohol is alcohol so let&#39;s not base a 1 star review off of that...just a small contributing factor.<br><br>My order of fish and fries was not good.  I would have expressed it to the waiter had he come around at some point to check in, but he didn&#39;t come around until the end.  At that time I was irritated and more or less had a full plate.  The fish was tiny and tasted burnt.  If you ask most folks, I&#39;m not one to complain about food.  I might say it&#39;s so-so, but I&#39;ll usually still eat it and possibly give a place another shot.<br><br>When the waiter returned and asked if I wanted the dish wrapped I said &#34;No thanks, the fish was overdone and not really edible if you can pass that to the kitchen.&#34;  He said &#34;ok&#34; and left.  When he returned we were handed a check for all 3 of our meals.  So let&#39;s pause here for a moment...if I&#39;m in some random grab&#39;n go place, then my expectations are not that high.  When I&#39;m being asked to spend $80 for lunch for 3, the expectation goes up a bit.<br><br>The waiter (which I have been several times) doesn&#39;t buy the food, cook it, clean the dishes or the floors.  The waiter delivers the food and makes sure that the front of house interaction goes smoothly for the customers along with possibly wrapping silverware or marrying the ketchup.  So I would expect that when I handed back a pretty much full plate and expressed a concern, that the waiter would take some action.  He chose none of that and ignored the problem.  I still left a tip...why I&#39;m not exactly sure, but it was just a couple bucks and well below the industry standard.  I even regret the amount I left but I basically subtracted the cost of the dish from his tip and left that.<br><br>I realized from the two trips to the Skokie Cheescake Factory what they lack.  Standards.  The waiters clearly don&#39;t seem to care and it&#39;s not just from this experience.  The time prior to this visit I was with a group all I personally ordered was coffee and had to ask twice for cream, clearly a very complex ingredient.  It&#39;s the standards and attention to even to a basic service which are virtually non-existent.  It&#39;s almost painfully clear on several of the waiters faces just how much they can&#39;t wait to get out of there that day.  The only thing that could top the experience you&#39;re destined to have here is if you go home, open a frozen box of fish sticks, throw them into the fireplace for a few minutes and then have a 4 year old overloaded with muscle relaxers serve it to you.  Because at least the standards of the 4 year old would be higher.
Very below average tea and dirty silverware.Not planning to come back unless it is for a family event but alright food

Giving this place a star is too <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmuch.it&amp;s=4ca585aefc241478af7ea12c3a186dfe168b2bf1ee451c235d2190153d70729d" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">much.it</a> was worst place ever. The burger I got  was raw and it smelled needless to say I spit it out. I could no longer eat. I was done for the night. I don&#39;t think I will ever go there again.

Yes, this place is a chain restaraunt but they consistently deliver good food, massive portions, and BOMB cheesecake. My favorites are the traditional with strawberry, and the white and black cheesecake. The steak here is really great, as is the miso salmon. Next time I come, I will try one of the pastas because the table next to us got some and they looked divine

They could slap a TGI Friday&#39;s sign on the front, and I&#39;d never know the difference.<br><br>If you&#39;re a country mouse, Cheesecake Factory counts as fine dining.  If you&#39;re a city mouse, the only reason you&#39;ll eat here is because you&#39;re probably desperate for something--ANYTHING--to be open late at Old Orchard Mall.<br><br>Standard fried fare--typical 20 burger menu where they vary by a couple of ingredients.  Large salads, pizzas and a few halfway decent entrees for those of us of a certain age who have to worry about how much grease we want in our arteries.<br><br>The schmaltzy bar downstairs is perfect for suburban cougars with their latest BoRics perm.  Upstairs, there&#39;s no place to escape the carnival-crazy paced atmosphere of servers running around desperately trying to keep up with the rapid table churn managers prefer.

Its a bitter sweet review this time...let me explain,  the food was good but the service..not so much. Steven the (waiter) brought our drinks but soon after that like houdini..he disappeared and didn&#39;t come back to take our dinner order. I had to get the attention of another waiter to place our order (wow). Steven eventually returned with a not so friendly demeanor  ( worse than before)..im not sure if I will ever return to this location.

I decided to meet a gal pal here for dinner and, from the start, was not expecting a mind blowing meal. It was a Thursday night so we were seated briskly. I have to say, I love how open this restaurant is and all the warm colors. The lighting also provides a very romantic, relaxing feel. Our waitress had a very unfriendly demeanor and looked annoyed throughout our entire meal. I do not think I saw her smile once...seriously, why are you even in this business? Aside from that, the food was good. The menu offers a large variety so it&#39;s quite hard to decide. Both my guest and I decided to settle with salads. I ordered the Luau salad- it was seriously bigger than my head! Not to mention, it was pretty good! It&#39;s filled with so many mixings so this salad is super filling!- grilled chicken, pineapple, cucumbers, peppers, green beans, carrots, onions, crisp wontons, and peanuts! Like wow- talk about a salad! My other guest ordered the Santa Fe salad and said the dressing, the spicy peanut vinaigrette, was divine. Surprisingly, at the end of the meal, I was stuffed! I did not pass on the cheesecake though. I mean duh- it&#39;s the cheesecake factory. I know I will be back here because, besides LEYE restaurants, I think this is one of the better chains.

Curbside to go at this location has messed up numerous orders in the past. After a long break from them, I gave this one another chance and they screwed up again. <br><br>I ordered a side and they passed it off that it was in the box and I had to show them that it wasn&#39;t for them to get it off my bill. They tried to charge me for something that wasn&#39;t in my bag. So this time I finally wrote on Yelp.<br><br>Years ago, a cockroach crawled out of my date&#39;s dinner plate and a manager comp&#39;d her dinner but not mine.<br><br>With such bad customer service it&#39;s amazing how this location stays in business. There&#39;s a lot of people traffic at Old Orchard so they don&#39;t need to care.<br><br>Avoid this location. Lincolnshire one does not screw up orders to go via DoorDash.

The foods were fairly decent and mouthwatering. The service we got was rather sluggish though the number of customers weren&#39;t that big that day. I believe we shelled out more because of the popularity of the restaurant and the elaborate garnishings that they used on their menu. It&#39;s a must-try to visit but it wasn&#39;t fully impressive.

This place has always been a place that we go to when we have no idea what I want to eat.  There really isn&#39;t a whole lot of critique here... Its a cheesecake factory and they have great service.  I&#39;ve never had a bad experience here.  Usually there is a big crowd, but I think the size of the place helps to accommodate the amount of patrons that show up.<br><br>Once there my wife and I typically get an Iced tea or a vodka lemonade..  depend on how sassy I feel that day.  It&#39;s usually for lunch.  <br><br>we always always have to start off with the Avocado egg rolls... why you may ask.. because they are some of the most delicious things ever created by the Avocado gods.  The sweet pesto like sauce they serve with it on the side just goes so well with them... they are always on point and consistent with them.  do it!! get them!<br><br>Then the entree either consists of the April special chicken salad sandwich with side salad and a soup.. . you cant go wrong... a little bit of it all.  Delicious sandwich a tasty soup and a light salad.  It fulfills lots of needs.  If I show up uber hungers... then I go for the Cuban sandwich.  I know, its not totally traditional.. but their version of it is mucho nice!   They use this slow roasted pork that is phenomenal.  The bread is crusty and toasted and has delicious goodness in between.  It is super filling.  <br><br>That&#39;s usually as far as I take my cheesecake adventure.  The place is great and has not disappointed yet.  Give it a go when you cant make up your mind!  Oh and if you ever decide to sit at the bar upstairs to have a drink or lunch.. ask for GiGi!!! shell make it a great lunch, shes super cool!

Service was great but the food quality not.<br>Medium rare steak was burnt on the outside<br>Pasta was under cooked and the sauce wouldn&#39;t  mix well inside.<br>Havent tasted the fly in the water, but I guess this happens. <br>Salmon was dry. <br>This is basic cooking. We expect more. Especially with your prices.
This place sucks we are wating like 30 minutes and we still aren&#39;t seated idk if it&#39;s a race thing but all the whit people get seated first

This is pretty close to my house and I usually come here on weekends with friends and family.  I have been here many times.  The interior is quite interesting and the seats are also comfortable.  <br><br>I like to get the chicken madeira, steak, and the eggrolls.  The cheescake desert is very special and it is tasty.  One time we went for my sisters birthday on a Sunday.  It was cool when the waiters came over to our table and sand happy birthday and also brought a cake.  We enjoyed it and had a good experience that day.

Came here last night for dinner with the siblings after getting my wisdom teeth extracted. The waiter was very helpful in providing possible food options for me, as I was still unable to chew regular food. Service was great, he was very attentive to our questions and needs. The portion sizes were quite large. My sister always orders the steak so I am assuming that it is quite delicious. Will definitely come again!

Had a random craving for cheesecake the other day...so I decided to race to the Cheesecake Factory with my bf at old orchard mall before they closed. I called ahead and ordered two slices of cheesecake. We got the original strawberry cheesecake and the turtle cheesecake. I&#39;m not a big fan of graham cracker crust sooooo i didn&#39;t really like the original. The turtle was good but I wouldn&#39;t recommend it if you don&#39;t like chocolate ganache as it has a giant piece garnishing the cake. All in all fast service, n good cheesecake..was kind of disappointed that they asked me to come inside to pick it up on the second floor since they have curbside pickup but I&#39;ll forgive them since it was 15 to close.

Haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in a while (prefer local) but wow, I&#39;ve been missing out.  Great service, bread was served warm and came out immediately, the lunch miso salmon was delicious.  Plus Server was knowledgeable about the menu, helpful with her suggestions, and checked up on me, without hovering!  One happy customer here!

Out of all the chain restaurants that are not LEYE, Cheesecake has to be my favorite one. Everything is always so delicious, either eating inside or carryout. This ends up being our default restaurant to order from when doing family dinners at home, though we order from the Lincolnshire location since it&#39;s closer. I recently dined here, and have to say that I like this location a whole lot more. Mainly two reasons why I like it more, since the quality and taste of the food is primarily the same. This location doesn&#39;t have the &#34;Lincolnshire vibe&#34; (I am sure some know what I am referring to when I say that) and I the interior is so beautiful and a lot more spacious. I haven&#39;t been to any other locations, so I am just judging between these two. <br><br>Food - LOVE both the dark and white bread that they give out, esp with butter. Mmm so good, but it fills you up before the real food is served! My favorite dish is the Chicken Madeira which is under their specialties. It&#39;s pricey, but it&#39;s a HUGE portion and the melted mozzarella cheese on the chicken is absolutely incredible. I&#39;ve tried three or four of the salads, all are great! Basically, I&#39;ve never experienced anything bad, nor has any of the people I&#39;ve dined with. I try to stay away from the cheesecake, but I can admit to having tried it just a couple times and it&#39;s always unbelievably good and bad at the same time... can&#39;t even imagine how many calories are in once slice! The two I&#39;ve tried are the red velvet and pumpkin - can&#39;t go wrong with those two flavors... EVER! <br><br>Regardless of the cheesecakes, the food is what I come here for, and I know I will  be back because I have yet to have a bad experience!

This is def one of my fave spots..you have to try the mac and cheese balls as appetizer! Entree get the Egg plant Parmesan..so much  i had enough for breakfast the next day! if youre looking to try a drink i got the blood orange mojito..def hit the spot
We love Cheesecake factory.  We have been here a lot of times.  Food is always good!  We have never been disappointed. We get entrees and they are very good and tasty.
I love their food here! Haven&#39;t had a problem with the staff..all very attentive! When I come here, I always get the misu salmon. It is amazing! And for dessert, the Godiva cheesecake!

Desserts on steroids. If they are &#34;known&#34; for cheesecake then I&#39;m at a loss, our peanut butter n chocolate cheesecake had 5 superfluous layers and a super sweet over the top &#34; frosting&#34; . Waaaay to much much going on. <br>Of course the portions are too big but every one knows this . <br>Way too much dressing on my salad. <br>Chicken salad sandwich is served on grilled bread which was cold when I received it. Bland. <br>Wife had crusted shrimp pasta salad, good. <br>Waitress was excellent. <br>Decor was weird. <br>Bill for 2 parents , 2 kids , one cocktail and 2 desserts was over $100 with tip. Wow.

Service was awesome. My waitress was Tammy and she was very professional and nice. The food was good. We had 2 appetizers and i had strawberry martinis and my guy had beers. I had steak and he had steak and salmon. Food was good. Just always feel like the cheesecake factory is overpriced.

I hate this place, I hate it so damn much I will NEVER go back. The waitress was so rude to me when I asked her for a burger with no meat is it really that hard to just take the meat out?? And I wasn&#39;t being rude at all I swear because I know how difficult it is to work at a restaurant especially one that is busy. I ended up getting a stupid ass salad because she was like &#34;oh honey you have to eat something&#34; I hate it when people call me honey, are you my grandmother? Are you my husband? In the end I wrote IDFWU on the receipt to be childish and she called the manager, that was the best part of the night. Also I&#39;m not the only one that thought she was being rude because my friend pointed it out first she was like &#34;why is she being such a bitch to you?&#34; It&#39;s prolly cuz of my hijab.

Came here with a crew after eating Hecky&#39;s turkey legs.  Yes, we were foolish enough to have cheesecake after devouring enormous sticks of meat.<br><br>Now, I&#39;ve been here before and have always had a decent time.  I have also had the cheesecake before and was satisfied, but remembered that the slices were incredibly rich and filling.<br><br>There were four of us, and, recalling the size of the slices, I recommended splitting 2 or 3 pieces at most between the three of us.  But no.  I was vetoed down.  Damn democracy does not work when the parties are uninformed!<br><br>So we each ended up getting a slice.  Four slices total.  First through fifth bites were excellent.  Then it started to go downhill from there.  Of course, as expected, we reached our limit and began to struggle, I mean really struggle, to finish our slices.  Delicious as they were, by the end we were filled with only feelings of shame and &#34;Holy shit my stomach is too full, please no more.&#34;  It&#39;s like in a crowded train, where two hefty riders are trying to squeeze into those tiny seats next to each other.  The riders are too big, the seats too small.  There is no room.  Now replace the train with your stomach, and the riders with a turkey leg and big ass cheesecake slice.<br><br>Now you may be scolding us in your head thinking, &#34;Well it&#39;s your fault for eating a turkey leg, then going all crazy and getting cheesecake on top of that.&#34;  Well, you&#39;re right.  But it&#39;s not an unimaginable situation, as many people eat dinner at the Factory first, then go on to dessert.<br><br>In economic terms, what happened to us is called diminishing marginal returns.  Layman speak: You&#39;d pay a lot to eat that first bite of cheesecake and boy is it worth it.  By the second or third bite, the amazingness begins to subside.  Keep going and soon enough, you&#39;d actually pay to NOT eat another slice.<br><br>So be warned!
