A few hints: 1)  take order immediately, 2) when parent asks for the check as soon as meal is brought please honor that request and bring the bill, 3) then actually stop by and pick up the check that has had the credit card sticking out of it for the past 10 minutes.<br>Added bonus-I always discover a sneaky charge on the bill that I am not in the mood to contest, This past week I was asked if I wanted milks with my children&#39;s meals, to which I replied, only if it comes with it, otherwise water is fine (bc my kids hardly drink milk with meals). Three milks came and I was charged 1.75 for two of those (my kids split one meal). I also requested a kids turkey sandwich (not on the menu) and was told no problem. The waitress brought a huge sandwich fit for a grown man, not a 27lb 3 year old and then was charged $9. Had the waitress told me that wasnt available but I could order the adult meal, I still would have done so, however I felt that was sneaky and was seriously annoyed.<br>However given the lack of other choices at Old Orchard I&#39;ll most likely dine in yet again, and be irritated once more.

This review is based on one visit. We stopped by to have dinner on a Sunday night. This may explain why several dishes were not available. In addition, some of the dishes that did arrive missed ingredients. How can you forget to add guacamole when it is a major part of a dish?  In addition, the service was very slow. Still, I give it three stars because they have an assortment of cheese cakes, and I simply love cheesecakes. If you are not a cheese cake lover, better options are available

I&#39;m not embarrassed to admit I love the Cheesecake Factory. This one isn&#39;t my favourite location, but it&#39;s five minutes away from my house, so I always end up eating here with friends. The wait here is usually pretty long, though not as bad as the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove in Los Angeles that I also frequent. They almost always make up for it with good service once you&#39;re seated, though. They have a huge menu with a wide variety of dishes. I have go-to dishes for every category, depending on my mood:<br><br>Appetizer - My favourites are the tex mex eggrolls and the thai chicken lettuce wraps. I wouldn&#39;t say the text mex eggrolls are worth the price, but they&#39;re SO good. And the thai chicken lettuce wraps come in an enormous plate -- definitely enough for a meal.<br><br>Soup - Clam chowder! Their clam chowder is so chunky and creamy; I love it.<br><br>Salad - BBQ chicken salad. Huge portions and really tasty, though there usually isn&#39;t that much chicken. I haven&#39;t tried any of the other salads, but they all sound really good.<br><br>Pizza - BBQ chicken pizza. It&#39;s the only one I&#39;ve ever tried, and I like it enough to stick with it. I wouldn&#39;t order the pizza here, though -- it&#39;s good, but there are better dishes on the menu.<br><br>Seafood - Miso salmon. Honestly, you can&#39;t go wrong with this dish in any restaurant, but it&#39;s especially good here. My only qualm is that it&#39;s fairly expensive at $19.95.<br><br>Pasta - Honestly, I&#39;ve tried almost every pasta dish on their menu, and I don&#39;t really like any of them. They&#39;re all decent, but I can never finish more than half a dish. The Louisiana chicken pasta is probably my favourite, though the spicy chicken cajun pasta is also good if they don&#39;t make it too sweet as they tend to do.<br><br>Specialties - The Cajun chicken littles are amazing when they&#39;re well done. Even if the chicken is dry or burnt, though, it&#39;s worth ordering the dish for the mashed potatoes alone. Mmm. The Shepherd&#39;s Pie (ground beef, carrots, peas, and onions topped with mashed potatoes) is my absolute favourite dish. If you make it here in time for lunch, order this -- it&#39;s only $9.95, and it&#39;s big enough that you&#39;ll bring home leftovers. Just ask them for minimal oil, otherwise it&#39;ll be swimming in grease. My most recent discovery is the shrimp and chicken gumbo. They&#39;re really generous with the meat, and the sauce is well seasoned. I find that it doesn&#39;t keep well in the fridge, though, so try not to bring home leftovers if you order that.<br><br>As for the cheesecake part... well, surprisingly, I&#39;ve only tried one of their cheesecakes (white chocolate raspberry) and I wasn&#39;t impressed. I always come into the restaurant and swear I&#39;ll order a slice of cheesecake, but I&#39;m always too full after my meal to even look at the dessert menu. Next time I&#39;ll skip the meal and come here just for cheesecake.

If I wanted to pay to be sick I would eat insects in the jungles of Costa Rica... <br><br>I haven&#39;t been here in a while because somehow I forgot what happened the first time; I ordered spinach cheese dip and I thought they were trying to poison me... since the spinach tasted so old and spoiled. After the manager apologized, they brought a popcorn shrimp dish... nice try but that was gross as well.<br><br>So after forgetting the disgust I felt years ago, I came back to try the cheesecake... I figured a place that had &#34;cheesecake&#34; in the name would have good cheesecake. <br><br>WRONG. <br><br>Not only did our waiter win the asshole of the month award by a long shot, but the cheesecake was enough to turn off even the more gluttonous stomach. <br><br>After waiting 15  minutes for the asshole waiter to get to our table, I told him we were ready to order and just having desserts... Which was my first mistake, because that&#39;s when his attitude started... God forbid anyone comes to the cheesecake factory wanting nothing more than cheesecake. <br><br>I asked him a normal question, &#34;Be honest, is your latte good&#34;, his answer, &#34;It tastes like a latte&#34;... thanks asshole I was imagining it tasted like orange juice.<br><br>Then we waited another 15 minutes (apparently it&#39;s a whole ordeal to slice a piece of cake and throw some coffee in a cup) <br><br>Well I should have thrown the latte back in his face, because it tasted like hot garbage, which should be a crime since it cost more than it would at Starbucks. <br><br>Next came the cheesecake, which tasted like it sat around for a good week before we were served. <br><br>I think they should cut down their menu and focus on making good quality food, instead of offering an array of throw-up worthy, spoiled garbage. <br><br>They should also re-train their waiters. <br><br>This place is overpriced for the crap that it is, and I will never come back. You would have to pay me to eat there because my stomach felt like it was on fear factor. <br><br>So if you like feeling like someone is trying to kill you, and you want a waiter who is going to be highly unpleasant the whole time, then Cheesecake Factory is the place for you.

It&#39;s all about the cheesecake.  <br><br>The place gets packed, loud, the menu goes on and on and it can be hard to decide what to eat for the meal.  The food is good, but not fantastic.  but the cheesecake it phenomenal.  <br><br>Personal cheesecake favorites:  Lemon Raspberry Cream, Tiramisu, Carmel Pecan Turtle, and my ultimate favorite is the Key Lime.<br><br>Sadly, I&#39;ve been on a self-imposed no refined sugar restriction for a while, and I miss those cheesecakes.  but for those of you who eat sugar, have at it!!!

BAD MANAGER, BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE, BAD FOOD. <br><br>I had been eating at this Cheesecake Factory in Skokie for years; probably since 2000. Well as of May 7, 2009...I will no longer be eating at this location ever again. I ordered a cream of mushroom soup that tasted nearly rancid, and a barbeque ranch salad that had unfresh romaine lettuce (there were pink spots on the ends of the lettuce). When I told my waitress, Victoria about the food, she acted apathetic as she walked away to call the manager. Minutes later, the manager came over to our table and we explained about the soup and salad and he was very unapologetic. All he said was, &#34;What do you want instead?&#34; He didn&#39;t even want to admit that the salad looked a day or two old! He also looked and sounded like Peter Griffin from the cartoon, Family Guy and acted like him too!! Very rude and condescending! <br><br>I was totally disappointed. They just lost one of their most loyal customers.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants. I enjoy the food, the ambiance, and the constant hustle and bustle no matter what hour of the day you visit. We typically order a bunch of appetizers to try to save room for dessert. Even then we are not always successful since we like so many of the appetizers. The summer rolls and lettuce wraps are particularly good. For dessert, I am partial to the warm apple crisp.

My friends and I just got back from cheesecake factory. Food was good. I had Shepherd&#39;s pie which was nice. The best part of our experience though, was with our waiter derrick. He was very kind, always checked up on us. Was very down to earth and got a couple laughs with us. Just because of him I&#39;d definitely come back here.

Why/how is this place always crowded and busy?<br><br>I ordered the garlic noodles. The food was salty and boring. My friend&#39;s dishes didn&#39;t look appetizing to me.<br><br>The cheesecake and service are good.

I love everything about the Cheesecake factory. I usually try not to eat at chain restaurants but this is one chain that I visit in almost every city.  The food and service is consistently good. I&#39;ve never had a bad food experience.  I almost always order the Chicken Madeira  with a strawberry martini.  I&#39;m usually too full for a slice of cheesecake...but I&#39;ve had several kinds of cheesecake and recommend all of them!
Good food, great service, and awesome cheesecake! The menu is a bit overwhelming, but you get over that kinda quickly. Favorite cheesecake is the white chocolate raspberry truffle. Enjoy!
The food is absolutely great! Sure it&#39;s pricey but it is delicious. The menu is a little overwhelming and often times the wait is longer than expected. But great food and a great time

The food was below mediocre and nothing was even remotely healthy or good. Very typical food - nothing special. Just feels like a very dated style of dining. The positives are that if you have kids it&#39;s great because it&#39;s crazy loud and they can yell their hearts out and it wont bother anyone. Besides that I would not come here again.

I guess I&#39;m the odd woman out here... I just don&#39;t get all the hype around Cheesecake Factory.  The food is okay, the service is okay, but I don&#39;t know.  I guess, maybe I expected too much.  Everyone has talked this place up to me, so I finally decided to pop in to the one at Old Orchard and was irritated by the fact that I had to walk through and entirely vacant first floor and up a ridiculous stairwell to wait to be seated.  I&#39;ll agree, that wasn&#39;t a long wait... once we were seated, however, the menu kind of disappointed me. I was expecting more, but I cannot tell you what.  I got one of the salads and it was okay, but WAY too much food!  I don&#39;t do leftovers, so that was useless to me too.<br><br>Then there&#39;s the fact that I have kids, and I&#39;ll be honest, this place is really disappointing if you have little ones, there&#39;s not much on the menu for them and the staff simply said, &#34;well we have pizza.&#34;  Oh joy!  Yes, for the parents of small children, this is not a relief.. it&#39;s an irritant.<br><br>If wouldn&#39;t say the experience sucked, but I can tell you that we&#39;re in no hurry to go back.

I&#39;m slightly embarrassed to admit I ate at The Cheesecake Factory, but a recent trip to Old Orchard with hungry friends had me acquiescing to this chain restaurant despite my pleas to go somewhere else.  <br><br>At an off peak 2 PM time slot on a Saturday, we entered to find the first floor completely empty and all business directed to the second floor.  As we climbed the steps, the loud buzz of customers gradually grew louder, and I was shocked at how busy the joint was.  We were seated close to the kitchen pass, where I could see food runners and cooks playing with the food, throwing stuff back and forth, letting food drop to the floor and not picking it up, scraping dirty plates and not bothering to wipe their hands before grabbing the next dish going out to the customers.  It was not a pretty sight.  But it&#39;s unfortunately more common than not; I just wish I couldn&#39;t see it.  I also witnessed three salads dying in the window, that just sat there the entire time we ate.  I feel bad for the poor soul who had to eat the limp greens.<br><br>Service was slow; our meals took a good 20 minutes to come out of the kitchen.  With servers and food runners abound, it seemed as if a more efficient modus operandus was in desperate need.  Side note, the uniforms were white pants, white shirts, and white shoes, and I felt a little bit like I was in &#34;One Flew Over the Cuckoo&#39;s Nest&#34; with the orderlies swarming the place.  I felt rushed and uneasy with all the activity and the noise in the room.  Twice throughout my meal, I had food dropped on me, once from a busboy cleaning the table next to me, and once from our server, who took my friend&#39;s leftovers into the kitchen (under our assumption that he was going to box the food), and he returned with said leftovers, a take home box, and my dirty plate.  Why he didn&#39;t drop the dirty plate off before coming back or why he didn&#39;t box up the leftovers in the back, or why he didn&#39;t just leave her leftovers at the table and bring out a box made no sense.    <br><br>Anyhoo, foodwise, I chose the crispy artichokes, a deep fried plate of hearts accompanied by a gelatinous aioli.  Together with a cold beer, it wasn&#39;t bad, but certainly not something I would return for any time soon.

This place is great for groups because the menu has everything from potstickers to grilled cheese. The problem is that they specialize in cheesecake and the rest tends to be mediocre, bland, and overpriced. <br><br>On busy days the wait can be agonizing, but at least they give you a buzzer so you aren&#39;t completely tied down for an hour. The atmosphere inside is rather nice and the service is decent, but really I&#39;d only go here for dessert. <br><br>Four stars for cheesecake, but the rest is two star material.

The wait is incredibly long. They don&#39;t take reservations if you want to eat after 6. You just have to wait. The food isn&#39;t anything special, unless you&#39;re there just for desert. <br><br>The service is good and the food comes in huge amounts.

Back for More!  Taste tested 3 desserts, here are the results...<br><br>#1 VANILLA BEAN!! (if you like light and fluffy cheesecake, great crust, subtle vanilla flavor.  this is for you!)<br><br>#2 Red Velvet-good choice. more cakey cheesecake. huge portion!!<br><br># 3Christ&#39;s outrageous chocolate cake-had a german chocolate cake coconut filling.  great if you like RICH chocolate cakes.  it certainly RAGES chocolate.  dark and moist.<br><br>Cheesecake factory does everything HUGE, so Share!=D

The Cheesecake Factory is fantastic.  The place has a menu the size of a textbook, and virtually everything is good.  Service is a hit-or-miss experience, unfortunately.  Don&#39;t forget to get some cheesecake while you&#39;re here!<br><br>As a Louisianian, my only reasonable complaint is that the Louisiana Chicken Pasta doesn&#39;t even come close to being classified as a Louisiana Cajun dish.  It&#39;s not a bad dish, but it&#39;s on the rather bland side in my opinion. If you want some real Louisiana food, then come to New Orleans.

Always a good go-to place when you run out of options.  Lots of variety and you&#39;re guaranteed to get what you&#39;re expecting (as what&#39;s described on the menu).  <br><br>I&#39;d give this place an extra 1/2 star for the service.  One of our diners didn&#39;t like her food because she felt it was too salty - they immediately checked if they could make it with less salt.  When they found that they couldn&#39;t change the recipe, the manager came extremely apologetic and provided different options that would be to her liking.  EXCELLENT customer service!

This is a great last minute &#34;casual, yet occasiony&#34; spot or whenever I am in the area.  Last time we were here was for my Mommy dearest&#39;s bday - mainly b/c we wanted to shop as well.  <br><br>The ahi tuna roll is amazing.  Deep fried and delish.  I personally LOVE the soutwest tex eggrolls.  They also pretty good pastas and usually have some good daily specials.  The portions are huge and the pricing is decent.  I feel like it&#39;s good for the portions given usually as entrees are big enough for two ppl or to pack for lunch the next day.<br><br>It&#39;s a chain, but def better than most and used to be one of my favorites.  They lose one star for taking out my FAV pasta ever (penne with pine nuts, chicken and mushrooms).  And they also lose 1 1/2 for not better accomadating us when we lost a phone there.  It is our fault for having left in the booth, but when we came back to check, no one else was sitting there, which leads me to believe a staff member had to have picked it up...I dunno - makes sense to me...The mgr did take my info down, but seemed so in a hurry and gave off the impression that it really wasn&#39;t her problem...not cool.

Ahh...the Cheesecake Factory.  I pretty much like all the food I&#39;ve tried here...Chicken and Biscuits, Bistro Shrimp Pasta, Fish Tacos, their various salads and appetizers.  Most of their food isn&#39;t for the Calorie Conscious, but who really cares when your full with tasty food!  They also have tasty drinks, one in particular, the Mango Smoothie with raspberry puree...delicious!  Don&#39;t forget to try their deserts, the Tiramisu is my fave.<br><br>Overall, good food, okay service, okay prices.

It&#39;s a classic. I love cheesecake. <br><br>Probably wont be having any for a while, since it&#39;s a &#34;New Years Resolution&#34; to be healthier, so I can&#39;t wait until my treat time when I will crave cheesecake factory pumpkin pie cheesecake
Kind staff nice enviroment and great cheesecakes! The food is good but a little bit overpriced! I will go there again to eat their fabulous cheesecake with caramel!

I like going to Cheesecake on a date night. It is a very big place. And their menu matches their size. Wish the menu was a bit smaller and concentrate on a smaller menu. The bread is good and no matter what you order on the menu you get what you pay for or even more. The portions are big and the flavors are good. Sometimes you might have to wait for 20-40 mins depending on date and time. Over all this is a good place for a date and to hangout. Great cheesecake

I have been here a couple of times.  Every server I have ever had has been great and friendly.  I love the southwestern egg rolls and the Cobb salad.  They used to have a skirt steak that I drooled over but last time I was there, I noticed that it was no longer on the menu.  My favorite dessert also is no longer on the menu (it was chocolate cake).  The only bad thing I would say about this location is that the last time I was there, the bartender was talking so loud.  We were not right next to the bar either.  It was annoying.

Well I&#39;ve been here for dinner, I&#39;ve been here for lunch, I&#39;ve had a very memorable cheeseburger that was HUGE and I come to the conclusion the only reason I would recommend coming here is the cheesecake. The food is overpriced for what it is, but then again, if you have picky eaters and want to go to someplace a little more fancy but still casual this is a nice spot to go to. There&#39;s something on the menu for everyone. As far as cheesecake goes, the chocolate chip cookie dough and Carmel pecan turtle are deliiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiicious.
I think for the price the food should taste better. Quantity means nothing if the dish tastes good one time and different a second visit. Service is awesome tho, nice staff.

Server sucked. Everything I asked if was good and only said yes. That&#39;s how you know they&#39;re on some bs. Got the orange chicken with brown rice. Brown rice tasted horrible, orange chicken was OK I guess. For 17 $ I could have went a block away and got 3 plates of better tasting. Only thing I liked really was the taste of their crab bites.

I used to love this place. Cobb salad, chicken madeira ware my favorite dishes. But now, since I stopped eating meat, i wish they had a better variety  of see food. I don&#39;t eat farm raised fish and tired of salmon so  nothing for me in menu. But for meat lovers, I think this place is wonderful!

I don&#39;t usually write reviews, but this place is just wayyyy to ridiculous. We wanted to celebrate my cousins bday here on a Sat., for a party of 17. So we called on Friday to make a reservation, and was told they don&#39;t take reservations on Saturdays. That&#39;s fine, so we arrived on Sat. And was told it will take about an hr and 10 mins while a bunch of parties of 3-5 get seated immediately. So I asked the server why does it take so long, has their party room been used? The server said, the room is not being used today.... And I&#39;m like ugh this is not logical. So u don&#39;t take our reservation, making us to wait for more than hour, while the party room. Is empty........ I duno what to say but they really don&#39;t know how to run a business!
Expensive for what you get.  Just your typical chain.  There&#39;s so many other choice of places to eat, that this is not one I&#39;d choose.

Having visited several Cheesecakes all over the country, this is definitely in our top 10 for atmosphere and extremely helpful and friendly staff.  <br><br>HOWEVER, at this CF, we are almost always seated in the same side-area with tiny booths for two (which, let&#39;s face, gets kinda boring) and are mostly disappointed with the food.  Last weekend was no exception.  <br><br>I ordered the Baja Chicken Tacos - bland and dry.  Now, I&#39;ve had these in Vegas (delish) and in Walnut Creek, CA (scrumptious), so WTH happened here?  Dry, tasteless, only a drizzle of cheese.  These are supposed to have some kick, boys and girls!<br><br>Alas, the iced tea was also bleck; some sort of fruitified-tea that left an unpleasant aftertaste.<br><br>The Darling&#39;s dish was okay - forget the name, some sort of Asian chicken over rice - but again, nothing spectacular.  <br><br>Usually get a slice of cheesecake, which is always up to par, but not this time.  The bill, though, for less-than-excellent food, with tip, came to $42.  <br><br>Took most of my meal and doctored it up royally for the next night, but decided we won&#39;t return to this CF.  Should have just gone to Hamburger Mary&#39;s for less cost and better eats.

i used to not like cheesecake factory but i have learned to co exist with it. the issue i had with the establishment as a whole is that there are a lot of items on the menu not all of which are made well - it makes for an overwhelming task to figure out what to get/a crap shoot. on a side note i&#39;m not sure why it&#39;s always packed/what&#39;s up with the twinkle palace decor...anyways i finally ordered some stuff that was pretty tasty. although i would not choose this as a place as a top contender when i have to come it is a-ok..it is what it is. <br><br>Some things i have had that were good:<br><br>santorini farro salad<br>mediterranean lettuce wraps<br>roasted vegetable pizza<br>fried zucchini appetizer with ranch (fyi the dressing is very garlicy)<br>fries

This place is good, it just doesn&#39;t knock my socks off.<br><br>Would&#39;ve gotten more stars, but these guys used to have a gluten free menu and now they don&#39;t. They don&#39;t even have the gluten free cheesecake anymore!  So I guess I&#39;m a little biased in rating, but they don&#39;t even have any gluten free guidelines, so as a customer with a gluten sensitivity, it is a little confusing to find something OK to eat.<br><br>I wasn&#39;t always gluten sensitive though, and even when I ate here before the food was pretty good, just nothing stupendous.  I think it&#39;s a little overrated.  <br><br>They do have a huuuuge menu though, so kudos to that (:

I had my birthday dinner here on the 25th of February. The wait was excessive, I wish they let you make reservations for larger parties. The waiter didn&#39;t even attend to us for like 20 minutes after we had sat down. They were too busy waiting on high school kids, like really as if they are gonna leave you a big tip. They took a long time to bring the food and then they didn&#39;t even throw in a free dessert for my birthday. They could have been more attentive.

Good dessert, ABYSMAL service.  <br><br>Went in this afternoon for some dessert, and was truly disappointed with the service from the get go.  Our server smiled at first, however she seemed angered by the fact that we would just be ordering 2 slices of cheesecake today.  She stormed off, and 10 minutes later brought us our dessert.  Another 5 minutes went by before she tossed the check on our table and walked off without a word.  She then proceeded to circle the area until a credit card was placed in the folder.  Without a word again, she grabbed the folder, ran the card, and brought us back the receipt in silence, and left.  We signed the receipt (leaving a rather generous tip for the service received), and needless to say we never saw nor heard from the mysterious waitress again.  <br><br>The dessert, like always, was great.  <br><br>For a place called &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;, the employees shouldn&#39;t be so surprised to find customers seeking their dessert menu only.

Always good food. Not sure if the food is processed or not or how quality is, but it sure is tasty and portions are huge. Never liked cheesecake, but their cheesecake turned my heart to REALLLY liking cheesecake--it&#39;s very tasty. Come here to splurge, not to eat healthy. Enjoy :)

I think this place is pretty darn good!  I have things to do in the mall, and often sit at the small upstairs bar there, read the paper, have lunch and a cocktail.  Their Mushroom Burger is really tasty as the mushrooms are &#34;marsala&#34; style and have a sweetness to them. The burger itself is fresh and tasty, and I accompany it with a small caesar salad instead of fries.  A nice meal. I also am a fan of the chicken madeira, which is consistently good every time.  Staff is always nice and the food comes out in a timely fashion.  Compared to other available options which range from really good (Blaze Pizza) , to good (Maggianos) to poor (Uncle Julios), to vomit inducing (Buffalo Wild Wings) Cheesecake Factory is a good choice.

Can&#39;t go wrong with my favorite Angel hair Shrimp. Big fancy restaurant with good portion size meal. I always have left overs for another meal. A little bit pricy, but that&#39;s expected.  Service is normal.
I went there with my  gay-friend and one of the waiters acted very rude towards my friend. He made him feel uncomfortable and unwanted there. I did not complain but I won&#39;t return .

Used to get the avocado egg roll and Lettuce wrap. But both have tasted different the last few visits. The Cheesecake is decent obviously, but the price point for a slice is not worthy since Eli&#39;s is so closeby to me.
Had the be pleasure of dining here tonight. Our server, &#34;Neelie K&#34;, was absolutely wonderful! The food was phenomenal as well, overall a great experience!

Besides being big and a good place to meet, I dont know why people come here, if not just for cheesecake!  A burger, a very small flatbread pizza and 2 coffees ran to $30...what the heck?!?  Burger was really nothing special and the flatbread was about the size of a slice of regular pizza, hardly any ricotta cheese and the sausages were so tiny, I almost missed them as surely couldn&#39;t even taste them!  The food, like the cheesecakes are way overprices and overhyped....but it is a good casual gathering place.

Since I was in high school senior year, my parents continued to take me here for my birthday dinners. Its a cozy spot, casual attire.  I always order my ribs here. I like this Cheese Cake factory better then the ones I have been to (Las Vegas strio, and the one in the John Hancock building) <br><br>Hey travel to the Old Orchard one  its worth your WILD AND PLUS its an out door mall all around the Cheese Caske Factory  so  go shopping and they will beer you on your pager when your table is ready!  Bring me along hahaha to EAT W YOU  JK

Beware of anything with cilantro in it.... They way over do it.  Other than that, it is a classy place with friendly service, but I feel like I was paying more for the environment than for the quality of food.
We came here couple times, and each time was very satisfying. The burgers are good. Fish and chips excellent..... and of course the cheesecake is delicious.

I have a confession. I love The Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve spent a lot of time at this location. My mother and I would go shopping at Old Orchard every weekend when I was a teenager, and this has always been our post shopping dinner spot. <br><br>I&#39;ve said this before, but I am seriously obsessed with their brown bread. Like I&#39;ve written to the company to ask for the recipe. For reals.<br><br>I love their entree salads. In fact, I never get anything else (except the thai chicken wraps).  Their Cobb Salad, Chinese Chicken Salad, Ahi Tuna Salad and Salmon Salad are all fantastic. <br><br>I am always tempted to get a slice of chocolate cake after dinner, but I never do. I read somewhere that it has about 1600 calories per slice. I wish I had never read that, because now I never get it.

I&#39;m currently parked outside, waiting for my curbside to go order. I have been waiting 15 minutes. I called the phone number as instructed, and was told someone would be out shortly. Disappointing. I do not recommend using this service, especially after having to move my car twice since people were using the drive as a drop off area.

Pomegranate Mojitos is God&#39;s gift to us in liquor form! So good! The service was good as my friend/host Natalie walked my entourage (11) and i in....We put together 3 tables so we could all sit together......this place looks fabulous.....extremely well put together..... inside huge restaurant and a nice size bar section.....our server was cool.....I didn&#39;t eat, just wanted to drink.....my friends ate and enjoyed there meals.....i did try Ashley&#39;s Crab Ragoon which was really tasty.......Natalie even sent me a free mojito which was awesome.....

I spent a lot of money here for a light meal recently and I&#39;m not sure how it added up so quickly. Oh, that&#39;s right, everything&#39;s mucho spendy here. I&#39;m sure the service is typically very good; I&#39;m a friend of someone who works at this location but she wasn&#39;t working on the one and only night we visited. Our waiter would disappear for long periods of time, and when we pointed out that the kitchen had sent out the wrong salad, he tried to tell us that this was the salad we had ordered. We had to read back to him the description of the desired spinach salad in order to convince him that the one on our table was not a spinach salad. I&#39;m certainly not a culinary expert, but I tend to think that a spinach salad would be the easiest of all salads to distinguish. <br>The cheesecake was outstanding; don&#39;t write off the lo-carb version made with Splenda. It has a crust made from crushed walnuts, which give it a great, unique taste.

Food is always consistent (and lots of it), service is always good--just don&#39;t think you can go wrong with any Cheesecake Factory in their chain.  I have eaten at them all over the country and it is always consistently a good experience.

I hate to give this place a bad review as I&#39;ve been a CF fan for a long time, but after coming here a lot since they opened this location,  this place has really gone downhill.  The quality of the food has really suffered, and it&#39;s just not worth the waiting time in line any more.  The past 3 or 4 times I&#39;ve been here, I&#39;ve gotten sick to my stomach with what I suspect has been food poisoning.  This is just not a coincidence anymore...1 or 2 times, sure, but 3 or 4??  I suspect something uncleanly is going on in the kitchen.  The wait staff is just not friendly or attentive.  I have had to sit there with an empty drink for a long time, and having to flag down another waiter for help.  I&#39;m sure other locations are better, but I will discontinue coming to this one.  If anything, I will drop in for a quick cheesecake to go.

For a chain restaurant, I think Cheesecake Factory is pretty great ... I definitely like it better than their sister place, Grand Lux.  Their loaded baked potato soup is the bomb, and server Brandon was great as I assailed him with questions about the menu (which is mighty), and the specials.

oh my god, girl! you don&#39;t even know! see, my little brudder emil and i used to not eat for most of the day, saving up all our hunger, right? then we&#39;d go over to the cheesecake factory and order like three appetizers and eat the entire things. oh god, its so good.<br><br>so i hadn&#39;t been in awhile. and tonight, emil and i were looking for some good old &#34;american food.&#34; emil suggested chili&#39;s, which i would sometimes be okay with, but tonight, i wasn&#39;t especially looking forward to loose bowels, you know? so we settled on the cheesecake factory. and thank goodness we did.<br><br>because my cousin layla had mentioned it earlier this week, my eye caught the &#34;factory appetizer favorites,&#34; which includes 8 samples of the wonderful appetizers the cheesecake factory has to offer. oh my god. 8 different appetizers? for real. included are cheese quesadillas, corn cakes, chicken pot stickers, avocado eggrolls, calamari, spinach artichoke dip, buffalo chicken strips, and these asian noodle shrimp roll up things. damn. and to top it all off, emil had nachos on the brain, so we also got an order of nachos. oh, and emil&#39;s girlfriend was there, so there were three of us eating 9 types of appetizers, not just the 2 of us.<br><br>so. my all-time favorite is the avocado eggrolls. its basically egg roll wrappers with an avocado mix inside, with some flavors of tomatos and some tangy green sauce. the chicken pot stickers are pretty regular, whilst absolutely delicious. the spinach artichoke dip is served hot, and totally didn&#39;t even congeal, even though it did kind of sit there for awhile. it comes with light , airy tortilla chips. that&#39;s right...i said &#34;light, airy.&#34; eat me. <br><br>moving on. the shrimp things were okay...i took out the shrimp because, in my opinion, ew. shrimp is gross. but the rolls were alright, containing noodles, lettuce, scallions, and both peanut and soy sauce. i could have done without them. the quesadillas were good, but i pulled out the pepper looking things. they remind me of leaches for some reason. emil said the calamari was fine. the buffalo chicken strips were really good. the meat totally didn&#39;t have any funny bites, and the breading was light and crispy. the buffalo sauce was pretty spicy, but the bleu cheese cooled it right on down.<br><br>what else did we even have? oh, the corn cakes. they were pretty damn good. our extremely handsome waiter, cleo, said they were his favorite thing at the restaurant. they are all he orders on his regular sunday afternoon cheesecake factory dining. and honestly, i gotta trust a man that handsome. i mean god, if you had seen him...damn. <br><br>okay, and the nachos were great. but when are nachos not great, really? go to the cheesecake factory. and even though i didn&#39;t do this, i would suggest getting a piece of cheesecake to go. eat it for breakfast tomorrow. you&#39;ve fucked up your health enough at dinner already...may as well make a day of it.

Ordered a cheesecake to go. Salesperson did not show me the cake (that&#39;s their policy). I got home, it had about a half inch of frost on it and was freezer burnt. Disgusting, never again. When I called to complain, the manager was not very helpful, seemed annoyed, she could offer a gift certificate, as if I would go back, or to replace it if I drove 40 minutes back to the restaurant. After some back and forth, she became more agreeable and apologetic and took my number, but not my name or card info to call me back to process the refund. She left a voicemail a half hour later saying a refund had been processed. Several days later, the transaction had not come off my card and was no longer pending. When I called the restaurant, another manager insisted it had been refunded and it would drop off. I explained that it was not pending anymore and that I work in financial services and understand authorization holds - this was not an authorization hold. He insisted it had been refunded, and read me the last 4 of the card refunded - not my card - they asked me repeatedly if I had used a different card. I had not. Turns out, goofball manager #1 had pulled up a receipt for the type of cheesecake I had ordered and refunded it, without confirming any info. Good job. Goofball manager #2 laughed about the fact that someone else got a freebie and promised to look into it. On the next call he was able to find my receipt and process a refund. Did I say never again? NEVER. AGAIN.

Was informed by the host that there are several dishes that are gluten free and that he would seat us in the section with the &#34;experienced&#34; waiter. Waiter told me of two dishes he knew to be GF. I have celiac so this is no joke for me. I understand that I eat at my own risk in restaurants and will definitely be more careful in the future. I don&#39;t know if the waiter sabotaged my food or the kitchen is just careless but the chicken stuffed tortillas were in no way or fashion GF. I was sick for 2 days AND developed mouth sores! All symptoms of being glutened. CF you are dead to me. I&#39;m sorry I even gave you a chance.

My boyfriend was in shock when I revealed that I had never ate here before. I&#39;ve drank here before but just never ate.<br><br>This place is awesome. They have an extensive menu that is sure to please anyone with any particular craving. I was a little overwhelmed by the menu, but everything sounded tasty. <br><br>We started out with their Tex-Mex Eggrolls. These were delicious. They were much tastier than their counterparts at Chili&#39;s. The quality of the ingredients definitely shined through.<br><br>For my entree, I got the Chicken Meidera and Shrimp Scampi. The Chicken was delicious. The Scampi was also good but wasn&#39;t exactly my idea of scampi.

Cheesecake Factory was never anything special, but the convenience factor got me in the door. They cater to such a wide array of customers that its impossible for everyone in your group to not find something worth ordering. But their service is downright sh*tty! We has a server (I think his name was Kent) who was the rudest they come. He never came to check on his and didn&#39;t even put in half our order. I guess his shift ended halfway through our meal, so he just left. No one took care of us. What the hell kind of service is that. I hear a lot of people complained about him. He is reason enough for my friends and I to never go back. This is the third CF that has terrible people working for them. I hope he get fired and I hope I never see him again. <br>Avoid this place on the off chance you&#39;ll get stuck with some idiot who doesn&#39;t want to work. <br>OO mall has a lot of new places, so you have a lot of options.

Horrible place.  My husband and I decided to stop by Cheesecake factory for a late lunch: 2:30 pm on a Thursday so no they were not busy.  We gave our name to the hostess and waited to be seated during this time 3 more parties came up and put there names in - all of these parties were seated before us.  The only difference between the parties who entered after us and were seated before us was the color of their skin.  My husband is black the those that were seated before us were white.  Complete case of racial discrimination.  When we asked the hostess why we were being seated last she giggled and said &#34;I don&#39;t know&#34;.  Needless to say we opted not to stay.
Everytime I come here, the food is always excellent. The portions are not skimpy and the service is fantastic. The salmon crisp, carpaccio, and the asian salad are delish! Drinks are equally good.

Service is very poor. As long as everything goes well, the staff are nice. If you have genuine concerns/issues with your somewhat pricey food (entrees can be $17and up), the wait staff immediately bring the manager. The wait staff should try to solve/ at least attempt to solve the problem on their own and if not solved, ask if the customer would like to speak management.  The waitress shouldn&#39;t just disappear and send the manager right away. Poor problem solving skills!! The manager was even worse- rather than giving us giving back the food after fixing the problem with the meal,  he just grabbed the food right out from under us and walked away. Very rude. He further threw some filthy accusations at us as he walked past us. Not the right way to solve problems!! Ruined a perfectly good experience. I would suggest that 9/10 the staff and food and atmosphere will be great. However, for that one time that something happens and you express your concern (which you have a right to) the wait staff and management become rude and horrible. Be wary of this place. Not a Northshore worthy experience. To be treated so poorly without respect and concern is not a place to spend your money. Please go to other places where customer are valued and treated better.

these days this restaurant is as good as they get.  At least in the bar area, ( I was flying solo and they did not want to give up their precious two top for a solo flyer) Good food, Attentive/Knowledgeable bartender/server...Wait staff that smile at you even when you are not their table and they speak....!!!!!  Managers admit fault...(disclaimer: did not have a problem but the bartender recognized the appetizers I order were coming out slow and he addressed. Proactive)  i could go on and on about my experience.  The  only regret I have on the service end is  PLEASE STOCK GUINNESS EXTRA STOUT...( then you would have me at HELLO)  Big ups is all I gotta say...big ups...the only detractor...the hostess stand...sorry they could use some work...otherwise i felt like they appreciated my business...

First visit to a Cheesecake Factory. Glad I went. Beautiful restaurant. Staff was super attentive and helpful. I sat at the bar since the place was packed. Matter of fact I got the last chair at the bar. The bartender was extremely attentive and courteous. She was also busy. She was running all around but I never had to wait for anything. I ordered a pasta meal (Chicken and Roasted Garlic) YUMMMO!!! It was awesome. I couldn&#39;t finish all of it. The portion was ample. I couldn&#39;t leave without having some....cheesecake. So I ordered a slice to go. They packed it all up for me so nice and neat with utensils and napkins to boot. Even though I still wasn&#39;t hungry later, I just had to dive into that succulent slice of goodness back at the hotel. MMM.....it was worth it. So good. If in the area you have to go.

Not having to wait a long time to be seated (as you would at the Cheesecake Factory in downtown Chicago) is key.  But in addition to that, the food is terrific and the atmosphere is nice and dark, which is just the way I like my restaurants.  Find a nice booth and enjoy the... breaded steak with teryaki sauce, or whatever it&#39;s called.

I either love my food &amp; experience here or I hate it. Their service and food is very inconsistent. Usually the biggest problem I have when I come here is undercooked salmon and/or poor service. On a bright note, their cookie dough cheesecake is sooo good!

Before my meal last night I would&#39;ve given this location 4 stars. The waiter David comes to our table takes our drink order (water &amp; coke). Comes back 10 min later to realize he forgot our drinks. We get our drinks  we order a burger, chicken &amp; biscuits, a side of eggs, &amp; mac &amp; cheese. Food took a lil longer than usual. The main focus of complaint was the food &amp; service. My boyfriend&#39;s burger was great, fortunately he noticed the inedible peel &amp; outer skins of the grilled onions atop before he bit in. We just asked for the onions to be removed. Biggest disappointment was the chicken &amp; biscuits. The chicken was tough as tho it was frozen. We tell our waiter who really didn&#39;t offer a solution, my boyfriend just asked for better chicken. I wanted to send the whole meal back it lacked in flavor. I&#39;ve had this meal before &amp; it was wonderful. I should&#39;ve got my usual, chicken Madeira. The manager comes to our table, advises their chicken isn&#39;t frozen his solution was &#34;so u want more chicken?, we won&#39;t cook it so much.&#34; We end up just taking the rest of the food to go. They didn&#39;t comp anything, they charged us for everything. I realize our waiter &amp; manager didn&#39;t even apologize. The worst part is when I got home. I open up the chicken &amp; biscuits. I try the chicken first which was an improvement. But i realized they added the hard bottoms of the biscuits to my meal which were completely inedible. Our meal was $50, which is a lot considering I barely enjoyed my meal. We&#39;ve spent triple that amount in other restaurants &amp; left satisfied, with no complaints. I honestly feel that my boyfriend &amp; i weren&#39;t taken as serious customers. I guess our appearance made them think we wouldn&#39;t know good food &amp; service from the bad. We probably won&#39;t be returning to any of the locations due to our experience yesterday.

My girlfriend loves this place so much it is a little scary. I have waited here before for seating, but generally its pretty fast seating. Once I ordered a personal pizza, and the manager came out and said he was remaking it, because &#34;something about it didn&#39;t look right&#34;, not sure what he meant,but I would say that&#39;s good service, and the pizza was good! Watch out for the decadent cheesecakes, one slice will feed two people.

Food is great and I&#39;d give 5, customer service is superb  but it&#39;s the safety of the place which made me give 2 stars. We&#39;ve been celebrating birthdays in this place and I&#39;d always come back and be satisfied. But this weekend has been terrible for me and this coming week since I came here , I believe it&#39;s a n accident and none of their fault if they could have at least sturdy had stable chairs and not so slippery floors. Me and my baby 17 mos fell on the floor as I tried to sit down holding the baby to put his shoes and the chair ( rattan light ) slipped away me and my poor butt landed on the floor. It was hard to get up and painful back has limited me from every bit of mobility I have and plans this Sunday were all cancelled.The manager was nice to help , they had a nurse to help and all and willing to call paramedics but I just would like to increase awareness to everyone especially old people to be careful in the chairs( movable ones) I&#39;m not sure if I can work this week and will be seeing my doctor tomorrow to make sure I didn&#39;t have fracture or hurt myself badly as in in pain to not be able to move comfortably. I&#39;m just glad that mom wasn&#39;t sitting on the same chair I did. I hope they put some anti skid in the chairs or something to make it safer. I really pray I didn&#39;t hurt my back bad.

Food is OK - too expensive for what you get though.  Service is good, sometimes not - depends on the server.  The place is LOUD - it&#39;s huge, but yeah, that overhead music is just annoying.<br>Finally - the plethora of outside company advertisements on many of the menu pages (virtually every-other page at the beginning of the menu) is annoying.  I don&#39;t want to look at a phone book - I want a menu of food I can order.  This place might fit in well with someone who enjoys pre-movie advertising at the theater, but I find it distasteful and I won&#39;t be back because there&#39;s nothing special about The Cheesecake Factory to overcome that bad taste...

I love this place!!!! I make it a point to come as often as I can, but really sometimes it&#39;s just for my or MIL&#39;s (mother-in-law&#39;s) birthday!!! Thing to ask for - Santa Fe Chicken Salad!!!!!! OMG - the portion size is insane, but you can ask for the lunch portion - depending on the time of day. Came here over the weekend with the boys and my lil sis and OMG did we enjoy our meal!!!! We started off with a Passion Fruit Mojito - YEEEEEEEEEEES I said it - Passion Fruit!!!! It&#39;s as delicious as it sounds!! The mint leaves are so fresh and  drinking the mojito definitely hits the STOP STRESSING button! LOL!! Anyway I ordered chicken fingers and fries for one boy, cheese pizza for the other, and pasta with Alfredo Sauce for the last child. Needless to say the boys ate and there was still left over for them to eat for dinner - SCORE (not having to cook dinner)!!!!!!!! My lil sis is now a TCF fan!

This is a pretty typical Cheesecake Factory.  Good food, good service.  Our food came out very fast.  Waitress forgot about my soup order, but left it off the bill.  It was like I never ordered it.  Whatever.  It&#39;s a pretty good place to eat if you don&#39;t mind spending a few bucks.  And quite large from what I could see.  The huge menu is what keeps me coming back.  And I&#39;ve never had something I didn&#39;t like.  Get one of the pasta selections and you won&#39;t be disappointed.
The chopped salad was really great. Nice portions. Good ambience.

*YAWN*  I&#39;m reviewing another cheesecake factory.  A wait for lunch on a Friday was kinda lame, but otherwise I was happy to see they had a &#34;lunch&#34; portion for the orange chicken.  It was still enormous, but slightly less gluttonous.  Service was okay, our server looked like one of the Backstreet Boys.
Not very good for large groups. Been twice with 8 or more and service drops to nothing because 18% is guaranteed. Last night took 2 hours 15 minutes from sit down to paying.

There are better cheesecakes.  The service every time we&#39;ve been there has been not too good.  Either waiting forever for bread or food or getting the wrong wine.  It&#39;s a pain. I know they are always busy, but they aren&#39;t the busiest one I have been to.  I go back, because we like cheesecake factory, I just wish there was a closer one.

Over priced,  not so great food,  long wait time(over 45 minutes just to get a table and over 15 minutes just to get bread and water and over 15 minutes just to get the food.).  It was also extremely uncomfortable just to be there.  The restraint had their thermostat set to something like 80-90 F.  So for the time I was here. I&#39;ve been here I was extremely uncomfortable and needed to drink a lot of water because I&#39;ve became extremely dehydrated.  The server was sorta in hyper mode and serving like 12 other tables)(for more tip)  so service was bad.  Would I come here again? Never.... I&#39;ve seen people leaving the restraint without eating because of the terrible service and the discomfort.

This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory.  For one, its not as crazy as the ones in &#34;the city&#34; so you don&#39;t have to wait forever.  It&#39;s typical cheescake fare and there&#39;s nothing like the tiramisu cake!!
A little less busy with all the perks.  Good food and really good cheesecake (of course).

I am a fan of The Cheesecake Factory. No doubt about that. I love the food, I love the ambiance. Their pastas are delicious. Their cheesecake is always the highlight of the meal!! But I can&#39;t really say the same about the service. I hate waiting excessively long to have orders taken, and even longer to ask for more water (not even any specialized drink, mind you). I&#39;d still come back, though. I love their cheesecakes.

This one star is particularly for the employee (Hispanic 5&#39;4&#34; male with mustache) who didn&#39;t even try to help me in front of the building after I exited the restaurant(@10.15pm) through the side door as he was coming out from the building with 2 big bags (food containers inside) and holding a big clear plastic cup of smoothie. Since the restaurant front door was locked after 10 o&#39;clock on Sunday, and we (my wife, 10 months old son, and I) just realized that we left something on the table, so I was trying to go back in to see if it was still there; however, as he walked out through the side door, he immediately told me that the restaurant is closed which I said to him &#34;i just walked out the building, and I left something on the table. Please let me go up and see if it was still there&#34; (the restaurant was still half full when we left). He apparently didn&#39;t not even try to help me and said &#34;you can&#39;t go back in there, the restaurant is closed&#34;. <br><br>1st, the restaurant should never lock the front door without anyone attend at the front desk which in my case, I can&#39;t go back in just to check on the table. Can you imagine if someone left their car key? <br><br>2nd, he didn&#39;t try in anyway to help the customer who actually spend money in the establishment to keep your operation running. He didn&#39;t realize that his partial salary is from what I spent at the restaurant. Regardless how busy your establishment right now, you definitely lose around $250.00 business a month as of today Mar 13, 2011. We spent $101.00 today with tips and $135.00 2 weeks ago. That&#39;s $3000.00 business in a year. The situation would had been different if he tried to call his manager for me or someone to come help me.<br><br>We have been trying a lot of restaurants(Renga Tai, Maggiano, outback, California Pizza, and Jolane&#39;s) as we like to eat out every Sunday.It&#39;s very hard to find the restaurant that you like, and I think for the restaurant is also very hard to find someone who would spend $100.00 a dinner with the economy we have right now. <br>  <br>In conclusion, my wife and I haven&#39;t been back to Cheese cake Factory for more than 8 years, and the foods were not as good as current. We just go back since 1 month ago because one of my friend recommended the &#34;Luna salad&#34;, so we go tried and we loved it. As well as the miso salmon, lettuce wrap, and fettucini chicken. We felt sad because we just started love to go there once every other week, and this was how we were treated. We decided not to spend a dime ever again at this establishment.

This place rocks! The menu has plenty of variety. Being a big fan of alfredo sauce, I highly recommend the chicken romano with alfredo sauce. This place gets plenty of business (which is a good thing, unless you need to eat right away), but it sucks that you can&#39;t reserve a table. I do like that you could dress up or dress down. The staff are friendly overall, though sometimes you&#39;ll get that snobby waiter on a busy night. Bring lots of money because the food is pricey!

I actually like Cheesecake Factory. They have a great menu selection and from the variety of dishes I have tasted from stealing bites of foods from my siblings so far they have all been good! I got the orange chicken last time and it was pretty good! My dad always gets the Chicken Marsala dish and it is so good!  We usually go in a big family group and get the table all the way in the back and its nice and secluded. We always ask for my cousin to be our waitress so our service is always phenomenal. Only thing that sucks is the wait, but it is a shorter wait at this location than woodfield.

I like buying cheesecake for special occasions; I always come here for them (my favorite, the 30th anniversary cheesecake) Buying is easy as there is a separate area for this which is usually pretty fast.  The restaurant itself is pretty good.  The service is great and the waiters are usually pretty helpful.  I like that the menu has a variety of options and the drinks are great too!

I went there with my girl friend, this is the first time I go to this cheese cake factory, I usually go to the one in Michigan ave in down town, and I like the one in down town better, the food and the service is good, but the main reason I go there is the cheese cake, but this cheese cake factory don&#39;t have much favor then the other one, I think I will go to down town one next time.

I went here today and received HORRIBLE customer service. The waitress took too long to bring out my drink, and take my order. It was also my sister&#39;s birthday, and we told the hostess about it, but she did not tell our waitress, so my sister did not receive her special treat and was very disappointed. Another disappointment was the fact that gratuity was already included for ONLY 6 people. Our server did not deserve the tip, and we did not like that fact. I am never returning to Cheesecake Factory ever again. This was the worst birthday dinner for my little sister by far. Thanks for ruining it, Cheesecake Factory.

The steak diane / salmon combo was perfect tonight (all the times I&#39;ve come here, I almost always gravitate to the same choice, though I have to say some of the salads are pretty decent too--if you&#39;re into salads, that is. I like food that&#39;s hearty, tasty, hot and satisfying, and for me, all those chicken dishes on the menu don&#39;t quite hit the spot like a juicy piece of steak or fish--both of which were cooked perfectly--tender, juicy and tasty, with lovely sauces and mashed potatoes just the way I like em - a mix of rustic &amp; creamy texture. I started off making a pig of myself with a bowl of rich/dark mushroom soup (there was something of a witch&#39;s brew of tasty veg &amp; seasonings in there that did it no harm at all--yum), and some warm/crispy french bread. We don&#39;t go here a lot (it&#39;s become more of an occasional treat than something like a routine), but it&#39;s one that I have continued to look forward to (clearly others feel the same way, judging by the 15-20 minute wait, but the minutes trip by quite nicely when you spend it looking through the menu and browsing the cheesecake counter). I think the point is that there are very few places locally that offer that kind of value, and also come with nice service, easy parking, a location near home, and a relatively short wait (15-minutes).  Risking a post-meal heart attack, we shared a big slab of lemon meringue cheesecake too (not the lightest choice in the huge cheesecake selection, but very satisfying!). I must admit that one previous occasion, the salmon was a bit more &#39;done&#39; than I&#39;d like, but tonight, everything came together (except for self control), and I feel like a happy king after a banquet. A special mention too for our most gracious and charming waiter!

This place caters to the ultra brand conscious, mall shopping, suburban yuppie.  The whole experience was really strange.  I thought the restaurant was too loud and too crowded and the place was decorated like a museum.  The food wasn&#39;t the worst I&#39;ve ever had but it was far from delicious and it was ridiculously overpriced.  It was sort of like eating in purgatory.  Maybe worse.

Even though it&#39;s a chain, I really like the cheesecake factory. The prices are reasonable and you get large portions.<br><br>Try:<br>guacamole<br>avocado egg rolls<br>crispy taquitos<br>beet and goat cheese salad

an oldie but a goodie this restaurant is. my girl &amp; i shared a ceasars salad &amp; it was pretty good but ive had better. she ordered the bang bang chicken &amp; shrimp which was delicious as usual. i got the shrimp tacos &amp; they were yummy as well. didnt have enough room for dessert but maybe next time!

I&#39;ve been to this place quite a lot since it&#39;s right inside the Old Orchard shopping mall. There is always a line during the weekend. But popularity doesn&#39;t mean excellence here. Everything at this place is okay, and they stops right there.<br><br>The food is alright for an empty stomach, but it leaves you no impression afterward. Of course, they&#39;re well known for their cheesecake, and the selections are good enough. I would rather stop here for an afternoon cheesecake and ice-cream treat rather than for a full meal.<br><br>The service is less than average, even though it&#39;s not too bad. You will have to wait for quite a bit to be served and the servers tend to forget special requests. For example, I often ask for no onion, less fat etc.., but they forgot half of the time. Sometimes they are nice enough to replace it, sometimes they just apologize and hope that you&#39;re ok with it. Oh well, I just don&#39;t really care, since I can&#39;t wait for another 20 mins until my food comes.

one of my favorite restaurants ever. i love the atmosphere of this place, and they have lunch specials u can choose from and i love their bread! my favorite dish is their thai lettuce wrap with the peanut suace, and also their famous factory meatloaf is awesome with the mash potatoes and corn. their dishes may be a bit pricey but their foods tasty.

Ok a bit random, but stick with me on this one.  Long long ago there was this episode of saved by the bell.  Lisa Turtle went on a shopping spree with her dad&#39;s credit card, but she got scared he would find out, so she had a pseudo garage sale at her locker, to raise money to pay the credit card back.  When it came time to tell her dad about the hi-jinks he was rather understanding and felt that issue could be resolved by  &#34;LET&#39;S go the the SIZZLER&#34;.  That&#39;s how i feel about cheesecake factory.  You know you&#39;re down, or stressed out, you have some kind of confrontation or problem, it can simply be resolved by going to cheesecake factory.  You pretty much know what to expect.  There is something for everybody, and you know that you won&#39;t be able to finish your portion.  Although I am a bit baffled, I noticed they now serve water in regular tall glasses.  I could of sworn they used to provide plastic boot shaped glasses.  Am i just completely off my rocker?  You don&#39;t really have to answer that.

If I was rating this place on just the food , It would get much higher ratings, sadly , there is alot wrong here. It is a really nice space here, pretty classy. The pleasantries end there, I sat and waited for over 10 minutes for a server , we were just about to leave when she finally showed up. The older lady next to us had it alot worse , I&#39;ll get to her later. I ordered the salmon over spinach , and the Crab Wontons. The wife ordered the Fettichini chicken and the kid ordered the pepperoni pizza. Then we waited ... and waited ... and waited , 15 minutes in all for the appetizers.  The poor lady next to us was sitting there when we were seated , and she was sitting there with an empty place setting when we got our appetizers. She finally got her soup about 5 minutes into out wontons. We then proceeded to wait for our entrees , for 25 minutes after our wantons were long gone , 30 minutes in all. The poor woman next to us finally got her sandwich after sitting with an empty soup bowl for 20 minutes as well. The place was full , but not packed to the gills like the wait would lead us to believe. My wife said the chicken she got was &#34;alright&#34; but I could tell she was still really pissed at all the waiting. I actually really enjoyed everything I ate , I gotta admit. While we ate , the woman time forgot finally got her food , and finished it. She called for the manager and the manager calmly explained that they &#34;were just really busy&#34; and offered to give her a certificate for a free appetizer ... what a dick. I finished my food and proceeded to wait for the check for another 10 minutes. I contemplated getting dessert , but by the time the server finally got there I was sick of being there. The prices were really high for what we got , I&#39;ve payed much less for better.  I usually judge restaurants 80% to 90% on the food , putting much less value on service , ambiance and cost. This place sucked so badly at those things , it just about ruined any chance at redeeming itself , ever.
A huge menu with spectacular food!  The cheesecake is great-many different kinds- and the wait staff is nice.

To start off I came here with 6 others to have a good dinner they put us in a booth and sat me on the outside very uncomfortable then the racist manager didn&#39;t take my residents card as a id like Wat the hell definetly not coming back here again very rude manager specially just sitting there staring cuz I guess don&#39;t like Mexicans but definetly choosing more wisely like they accept my I&#39;d  everywhere else including the casinos seriously very disappointed
I really like their large menu. Great place if you are very hungry. Location is very cool and convenient, especialy for people who like to shop:) Bartender was very nice.

yum yum yum. with over 15 varieties of cheesecake, this is a dessert lovers heaven, if you aren&#39;t full. the wait here is always long, but the food is great and worth the wait. it&#39;s hard to save room for dessert.
Awesome service, awesome food, and awesome cheesecake. Couldn&#39;t ask for more and I plan on going back very very soon.

This place is OK. Service is very slow(as always), our waiter would disappear for some time and we were like &#34;hello... we need some drinks, someone please help us:)&#34;.  Great menu selection. Food is OK.

Okay place, nothing special. Ive been here many times when theres on those days where u cant think of another place to go too. Theres nothing really great to eat here, but the crab sandwich is good. The waiters here are alright, theres one waiter who thinks hes gods gift and that hes a model, he may be cute but he was rude and had no sense of humor, just took our order and left, didnt try to make a conversation with us at all. When we first sat down he didn&#39;t even give us bread, not till we ordered, my friend then ask if we could have bread and he just took it from another empty table and gave it to us and quickly left to put in our orders, so we had to ask another waiter for the butter. We got our food and ate, he ask us if we wanted dessert and we ask him which cheesecake is supposedly the best, his respond &#34;there all pretty good, just try one.&#34; last time i ask a waiter which is the supposedly the best one he pointed to me the Godiva cheesecake (super chocolaty but great), this waiter didnt care what we order as long as we order something, he seem kind of in a rush also. over all its an a-okay place. sometimes its nice and sometimes its not. ehhhh.
